loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 25-year-old married woman with four children aged between three and nine years; all of her children are currently in school. Agnes resides and owns a four-room house which she shares with seven people. Agnes cares for additional family members in addition to her children. The family has access to electricity but not piped water. Agnes owns a bar selling all types of drinks, and she commutes from Mengo Kisenyi to her bar in Lugala Masanafu. On average she receives around 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for three years working with the same groupmates. Agnes uses public transport to and from shopping. Her challenges include defaulters and ever-increasing prices of liquor. Agnes wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She is aspiring to see her business grow stronger and start a beer deport.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 60 years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors and sizes in the market; she has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She is seeking a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell to keep up with demand. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of five children. In 1999, she decided to buy a sewing machine to start a business working as a home based tailor after having sixteen years of experience in this field.

Today, Sawsan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S., who lives in Barangay 2, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is 46 years old and married to Loreto S., who helps her in running their business, especially her carinderia or restaurant. They are blessed with two adult children who are 25 and 27 years old. Their children are already finished with their college studies, having taken Commerce & Criminology courses. It is a great benefit for couples to send their children to school and enable them to finish their studies. It takes dedication, hard work and helping each other to achieve their dreams. It also takes the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon to help them succeed as entrepreneurs. Looking back to before they started and where they are now, the couple dreamed of sending their two children to school and putting up their own business, one that would grow progressively. That’s why, to put their dream into effect, they started a very small oyster-breeding (talabahan) business and a little restaurant at their home. The couple still continues their businesses because, even with a small income, it still helps the family. But then the demands of the household and school expenses were increasing and, if they stayed at the same income, it would not be enough for them to sustain their needs. That’s why, in June 2005, Elizabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have added capital for her existing business. Elizabeth continued her loans until such time as she totally improved their businesses: for her oyster-breeding she was able to widen the area, and her restaurant has also expanded. In addition to this, she started pig-raising as an additional source of income. In fact they earn Php 10,000 per month, a big help to the couple in sending their children to college and in continuing to expand their businesses. During this time, Elizabeth maintained her good credit performance with NWTF-Project Dungganon. For her previous loan, Elizabeth borrowed Php 29,500 as additional capital for her businesses. The loan was, as usual, fully repaid on time and without any delays. She wishes to borrow the same amount of Php 29,500 for her 19th loan. This amount will be used for her restaurant and pig-raising businesses. The couple is very happy because their dreams are successfully achieved. Now, Elizabeth continues with her loans and with her businesses. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her restaurant and for her pig-raising businesses

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 49 year old married man and the father of 4 children. He works in the house construction business and is the sole support for his family. He has been involved in this industry for more than 25 years. Today, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase wood in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: C8687 Duharanirekujyambere Group

texts.en:
Uwimana F. is 43 years old and married with 8 children, aged 2 through 21 years old.  Together they live in the Rubavu district in Gisenyi province, near Kigali. 

Uwimana's business employs 7 other people in her community and has been in existence since 1999, making this her 10 year anniversary of successful operation! The hours of her successful retail banana business are from 8AM - 5PM daily.  She serves locals and passers-by delicious, fresh bananas and for this she projects a monthly profit of 40,000 RWF (approximately US$ 80).  This loan will help her to buy more inventory and get better pricing which will help her to become more profitable and efficient.  

This is Uwimana's second loan from VFC and her previous loan was repaid in full and on time.  She is grateful to VFC and Kiva for their support of her business.

loans.use: More  bananas for resale

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 27 year old single man who lives with his parents. He has owned a bus since 2001 and uses it to serve the neighboring villages. Thanks to his business income, he has been able to satisfy his life's needs. Today, Maher is applying for a loan of $1,000 US to perform maintenance on his bus in order to successfully continue his work and make a good income.

loans.use: for maintenance on his bus

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 38 year old married man with 3 children who still attend school. He has owned a van delivery business since 1995 and provides better living conditions for his family. He's a very hardworking man and with his loan he will do the necessary maintenance for the van to meet the demands of the market and will be able to send his children to school.

loans.use: necessary maintenance for his delivery van

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells sarongs of various colors in the market. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the requirements of her clients. She is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 (US$675) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of one child. After having her first child, she decided to help her husband by working as a home-based tailor starting in 2000.

Today, Rima is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more materials to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Helen is 25 years old, married, and six months pregnant. She rents a four room house where she lives with seven people.  Helen takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a veterinary shop selling all kinds of chicken and animal feed in Busega. She pays for transport costs for the products she buys in Mengo Kisenyi for her shop in Busega, on the outskirts of Kampala. On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for two years and with MCDT for four years, servicing her tenth loan and working with the same group mates.  Helen uses public transport to and from shopping. Her challenges include customer defaults and the ever increasing price of poultry and animal feed. Helen wants to use this loan to buy more bags of animal and chicken feed. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more animal and chicken feed

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en:
Yinka is forty years old and married with three children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs in the market. She has been in business for the past nine years.

Yinka is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Wael's Group

texts.en:
Wael is a 32-year-old married man with one child. In 2008 he decided to open his own computer and phone shop after six years of experience in this field. 

Wael is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a new desk chair for his shop.

loans.use: To buy a new desk chair

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married man with two children. Since 2001 he has owned a van he uses to make deliveries to neighboring villages. He works on call for clients, and his delivery service is in great demand. 

Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1,200 to replace his van’s motor. His wish is to improve his business and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To replace his van's motor

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 45 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen utensils. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 28 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past six years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Saray Y Responsabilidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Elia is a 48-year-old borrower who lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Elia is the coordinator for her group, Saray y Responsabilidad, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Elia lives in La Habana, a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro. She lives with her two teenage children and is also raising her niece. Elia runs a small colmado from her home. Colmados are small corner stores that sell food, drinks and general household products for the residents in the neighborhood. Elia’s colmado focuses on food only, and she sells the basics of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, plantains, sugar, flour and oil.

San Pedro is a small city with many amenities. Unfortunately, there are several neighborhoods which lack access to those amenities. La Habana is one of those neighborhoods. Most of the city has running water, somewhat reliable electricity, and decent waste management, but La Habana lacks all of these. Despite the difficulties in her community, Elia is happy that she now has access to loans which have given her more business in her neighborhood. With the extra profits from her business, Elia is able to better raise her children and she hopes to send them to university after they finish high school. Thank you for your loan to Elia and the Saray y Responsabilidad group!

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Fansi

texts.en: Fansi sells jewelry to make a living. She is 44 years old and married with one child. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Flor America

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es reconocida por sus escritores y artistas así como por  su belleza arquitectónica, además tiene paisajes muy hermosos por su geografía accidentada su clima frió  contrasta con el calor de su gente amable y cordial como nuestras socias. 

La señora  Flor V. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, es socia activa del  banco comunal Alianza Unida, tiene 41 años de edad esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 23, 21, 15 años de edad, su hijo mayor ya trabaja y le ayuda con el pago del servicio de energía  eléctrica, el segundo estudia en la Universidad Católica de Cuenca y su ultimo hijo en el Instituto IEISA,  mantienen una buena relación intrafamiliar;   tienen casa propia pero no viven en ella pues les queda muy lejos de su trabajo y colegio por lo que viven arrendando. 

Flor es comerciante desde hace cinco años tiene un puesto de audio y video  (vende cd de toda clase de música y películas) en un local arrendado, nos cuenta que  esta temporada se encuentra un poco bajo el  negocio pero está segura que pronto va  a mejor.  
 
Flor lleva ocho años trabajando con la fundación y nos comenta que los créditos le han  permitido incrementar su negocio,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de películas, videos musicales, videos didacticos, etc. para abastecer su negocio con mercadería para niños y adultos.

Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Alianza Unida Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its writers and artists as well as for it beautiful architecture. It also has beautiful scenery and an uneven terrain. Its cold climate contrasts with the warmth of the kind and cordial people like our members. Flor V. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is an active member of the Alianza Unida Communal Bank. She is 41, married, and has three children. They are 23, 21, and 15. Her oldest son works and helps with the electricity payments. The second child attends the Catholic University of Cuenca. Her last child goes to the Instituto IEISA. They maintain a good family relationship with each other. They have their own house, but they do not live in it because it is very far from their work and school. They live in a rented house. Flor has been a business person for five years. She has an audio and video stand (she sells CDs and all types of music and movies), which is in a rented location. She tells us that this season business is down a bit, but she is sure that it will soon improve. Flor has been working with the Foundation for eight years. She tells us that the loans have allowed her to increase her business. With this loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy movies, musical videos, and educational videos, etc. to stock her business with merchandise for children and adults. Her greatest dream is to see her children become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy movies, musical videos, and educational videos,  for children and adults

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es: Libertad es un grupo de 12 mujeres   alegres y dinámicas, re agruparon recientemente por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita ampliar sus negocios, una de los integrantes es Emma Q., ella tiene el negocio de elaboración de zampoñas (instrumento musical de viento), se animó a ingresar a el grupo porque necesita préstamo para comprar la materia prima con el cual elabora sus zampoñas, que se llama challa, este material es difícil de conseguir por lo que tiene que viajar a los Yungas de La Paz o a Santa Cruz (departamento de Bolivia), trabaja todos los días, pero los martes y viernes entrega sus productos a su tío  quien acomoda a otros mercados. Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios que en su mayoría es el tejido de mantas y necesitan el préstamopara comprar materia prima.
texts.en:
Libertad is a group of 12 happy and dynamic women. The recently formed the group out of the necessity to have money that would allow them to expand their businesses. Emma Q. is one of the members. She has a business making “zampoñas” (a wind musical instrument). She was excited to join the group because she needs a loan to buy raw material to make her “zampoñas”. The material she uses is called “challa”, and it is difficult to get. You have to travel to the Yungas (valleys) of La Paz or the Santa Cruz (in the department of Bolivia) to get it. She works every day. On Tuesdays and Fridays she takes her products to her uncle who places them in other markets. The other members also have their own businesses. Most of them weave blankets and need a loan to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material ("challa" to make wind instruments and wool)

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She is in the catering business and has been in the industry for the past 9 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more baking materials. She say thank to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: A. Félicité est née à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Félicité est mariée à OSSENI Aliou, un chauffeur. Félicité et Aliou ont six enfants à charge dont quatre sont les leurs. Tous les enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont. La famille vit au quartier Dowa à Porto-Novo. Félicité assurent avec Aliou les charges de la famille. C’est des tubercules d’igname que Félicité vend au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo. Félicité va jusqu’au Centre du Bénin pour s’approvisionner en tubercules d’igname, plus précisément à Glazoué, un des marchés internationaux des produits vivriers du Bénin. Félicité est une cliente de ALIDé qui a eu déjà deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Mais, toujours est-il que Félicité n’a pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour satisfaire toute la demande de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Félicité sollicite ce troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Félicité was born in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to OSSENI Aliou, a chauffeur. Félicité and Aliou have six children to support. Four of these children are their own. All the school-aged children are in school. The family lives in the Dowa district in Porto-Novo. Along with Aliou, she ensures that family expenses are covered. Yam tubers are what Félicité sells at the Ouando market of Porto-Novo. She goes to central Benin, more precisely to Glazoué, one of the international markets for staple foods, in order to stock up on yam tubers. Félicité is an ALIDé client who has already had two loans, which she has repaid. Though as ever, she lacks sufficient financial means for satisfying all the demands of her customers. For this reason, she’s requesting this third loan for bolstering her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a truckload of yam tubers

loans.name: C5523 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
V. Tuyambaze is married with 3 children and one dependent that the family cares for, all are aged 3 - 15 years old.  The family live in Gisenyi in the Rubavu District about 3 hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  

V. and her group own and operate a successful, popular gathering place that is licensed to serve beer, wine and spirits as well as soft drinks, juices and water along with snacks and locally prepared finger foods like samosas and boiled eggs.  V. employs 4 people in her business which has been in operation for 12 years.  She makes approximately 100,000 RWF / month from the establishment.   

This is V.'s first loan from VFC and she hopes that it will allow her to buy more inventory and a variety of products to sell to her existing customers and hopefully attract new ones.  With the expected profits, she will provide additional food for her family and set aside money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: More merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel sells building materials to earn a living to meet the needs of his immediate family members. He has been in this business for many years. He is 42 years old and married with 2 children. He hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie N. is 31 years old, married with 6 children aged between 6 months and 13 years.  Marie lives in the northern province of Rwanda, Nyarwondo center where she has a shop in which she sells a variety of goods plus potatoes. Marie has been an entrepreneur selling a variety of goods in her shop for the past 10 years. She employs 3 people in her business. Her shop is open from 6AM to 4PM every day.

Marie is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose expanding her shop through purchasing some additional goods for sale which she hopes will serve her existing customers better and perhaps attract new ones as well.  With this loan, Marie expects that her business will make additional profits.  With this extra money, she hopes to improve her life situation.

loans.use: More merchandise for her store

loans.name: Omotude

texts.en: Omotude is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She sells medicines within her community in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 36 years old and is married with three kids. He is engaged in the rental of DVDs and also operates a phone centre.

For the past seven years, Mohamed has been selling and renting DVDs.  Prior to his current location, Mohamed sold and rented DVDs from his backpack, traveling to his customers. He was constantly moving around to meet his customers until he rented a shop with money he saved over the years. He is very hardworking and works from 8:00 am to 11:00 p.m. daily. His wife usually assists him in the shop.

Mohamed is seeking a loan to buy more DVDs to stock his shop and to buy more calling cards to better operate his phone centre. He hopes that the profits from the loan will be used to pay for his children’s schooling. This is Mohamed’s first loan.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and calling cards

loans.name: Florence Adegoke

texts.en: F. is 55 years old and married with three children. She sells plastic and has been in the business for the past 20 years. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more plastic to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic to sell

loans.name: C8639 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
V. Nyirasafari is 27 years old, married without children but with one dependent whom they care for and who is 15 years old. Her husband works as well, and earns approximately 60,000 RFW per month (105 US dollars).  V. and her family live in Rubavu district, in the western province of Rwanda where her retail shop is located.  V. is a seasoned entrepreneur with 5 years of successful businesses, selling different kind of products in her  locally popular General Store.

V. is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to add to her working capital, purchase more inventory, provide more products to her existing customers, and hopefully attract new customers as well.  She projects that her monthly profit will increase significantly more than the current level of 80,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: More merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en:
Pacifique N. is 33 years old, married with 5 children aged between 5 and 13 years. Pacifique lives in the northern province of Rwanda where she has owned a business since 2005. Pacifique's shop is open from 9AM to 6PM every day. Pacifique is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing a variety of goods.

Through accessing this loan, Pacifique hopes to attract additional customers. If she is successful in her business, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. In addition, she hopes to help her community by bringing more high quality goods closer to them at the cheapest price.

loans.use: Additional Inventory

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo sells plastic and has been in the business for the past 18 years. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State. She is 43 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more plastic to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic to sell

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: D. Angèle Jocelyne est née en 1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Angèle Jocelyne est mariée à AHOLONKPONOU Roger, un enseignant déjà à la retraite. Angèle Jocelyne et Roger ont huit enfants à charge dont six sont les leurs. Tous les enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont. La famille vit au quartier Louho à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Angèle Jocelyne avec son mari assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Angèle Jocelyne vend à son domicile des divers (galettes d’arachide, farine de manioc, chaussures, huile végétale, boisson locale alcoolisée, détergents, etc.). C’est à Agonlin Covè dans le Département du Mono que Angèle Jocelyne va s’approvisionner en galettes d’arachide, farine de manioc, huile végétale et boisson locale alcoolisée. Les chaussures et détergents, Angèle Jocelyne les achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Angèle Jocelyne est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé et sollicite celle-ci pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
D. Angèle Jocelyne was born in 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to AHOLONKPONOU Roger, a teacher who is already retired. She and Roger have eight children to support. Six of these children are their own. All the school-aged children are in school. The family lives in the Louho district in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin. She and her husband together ensure that family expenses are covered. At her home, Angèle Jocelyne sells various items (peanut cakes, cassava flour, shoes, vegetable oil, alcoholic drinks, detergents, etc.) Agonlin Covè in Mono County is where she goes to stock up on peanut cakes, cassava flour, shoes, vegetable oil, and alcoholic beverages. The shoes and detergents are purchased at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Angèle Jocelyne is on her third loan with ALIDé and is requesting it for bolstering her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of peanut oil and drinks, as well as baskets of peanut cakes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel K. is 32 years old and is single. He is an entrepreneur who lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where he has a photo-studio and a cafeteria plus movies to rent. His business is open from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day and he has operated his business successfully for several years.

Samuel is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing some new computers and other new accessories to attract more customers to his business.

Through accessing this loan, Samuel hopes to earn more profit, which will help him to set aside money to buy his own house.

loans.use: To buy additional computers and equipment

loans.name: Damarce

texts.en:
Damarce N. is 53 years old and is married with six children aged between 3 to 21 years. Damarce lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where, since 1994, she has had a successful shop selling general goods; 2009 is the fifteenth anniversary of her business! She employs four people in her shop, which is open from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day.

Damarce requested her loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her shop through purchasing more foodstuffs and other goods. This will provide her with goods which she doesn’t currently have in her shop and which she believes her customers will appreciate.

By receiving this loan, Damarce hopes that her business prospects will improve. And, with the extra profits received, she will be able to pay school fees for her six children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato is a 53-year-old dairy cow farmer and bricklayer.  A single father of two children,  Donato has been working with dairy cows for over 15 years now on a plot of land that he inherited from his father and that he shares with his brother.  Some of the milk he produces goes to the local milk company, Pil, and the other part Donato uses to make soft cheese for sale in the markets.  Donato lives in Maica Amba, which is a rural area behind the airport in Cochabamba's.  

With Donato's recently paid-off CIDRE loan he purchased a dairy cow, an acquisition that has really helped to increase his earnings. With this second loan from CIDRE, he will purchase a high-quality dairy cow that should help him produce about 25 more liters of milk each day.  This will greatly increase Donato's earnings and assist him in improving his children's quality of life .

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 37 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles and sells hair extensions to her clients within her community in Ibadan, Oyo state. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more equipment for her business

loans.name: Zoila Mercedes

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es reconocida por sus escritores y artistas así como por  su belleza arquitectónica, además tiene paisajes muy hermosos por su geografía accidentada, tiene clima frio  que contrasta con el calor de su gente amable y cordial como nuestras socias. 

La señora Zoila Mercedes P. Guambaña vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una socia activa del banco comunal Alianza Unida, tiene 57 años de edad es soltera y vive con sus sobrinos que quedaron huérfanos desde pequeños y ahora ya tienen 30 y 20 años de edad lso considera sus hijos, la casa en la que habitan es propia.

Zoila se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, los adquiere en pie y  los comercializa pelados en  las tiendas de su comunidad y también en su local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, lleva veinte años trabajando en este negocio y nos comenta que con este trabajo ha logrado sacar a sus sobrinos adelante.

Zoila trabaja desde hace cuatro  años con su banco comunal y con los créditos obtenidos ha logrado mantener su negocio y educar a sus sobrinos, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de más pollos para incrementar  su negocio y superarse cada día más.

Su gran sueño es construir una casa pequeña por el sector donde vive para montar ahí su negocio.
texts.en:
The Alianza Unida Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its writers and artists as well as for it beautiful architecture. It also has beautiful scenery and an uneven terrain. Its cold climate contrasts with the warmth of the kind and cordial people like our members. Zoila Mercedes P. Guambaña lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is an active member of the Alianza Unida Communal Bank. She is 57 and single. She lives with her nephews who were orphaned when they were little. They are now 30 and 20, and she considers them to be her children. The house they live in is her own. Zoila buys and sells chickens. She gets them live and sells them plucked to stores in the community. She also sells them at her place, which is located in the center of the city. She has been in this business for twenty years. She tells us that this work enabled her to get her nephews ahead. Zoila has been working with her communal bank for four years. With the loans she has received she has been able to keep her business and educate her nephews. With this loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy more chickens to increase her business and improve herself more each day. Her big dream is to build a small house in the area where she lives in order to establish her business there.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens to increase her business and improve herself more each day

loans.name: Cica Bernadette

texts.fr: G. Cica Bernadette est née en 1959 à Allada dans le Département de l’Atlantique. Cica Bernadette est mariée à ALALE Julien. Cica Bernadette et Julien ont huit enfants dont sept sont encore à leur charge. Tous les enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont. La famille vit à Dowa à Porto-Novo. Cica Bernadette et Julien assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Cica Bernadette vend au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo : des tissus, des chaussures, des glacières et des bols. C’est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin que Cica Bernadette va s’approvisionner en ces différents articles. Cica Bernadette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Cica Bernadette sollicite ce troisième crédit pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
G. Cica Bernadette was born in 1959 in Allada in Atlantique County. She is married to ALALE Julien. Cica Bernadette and Julien have eight children, of whom seven are still in their care. All the school-aged children are in school. The family lives in Dowa in Porto-Novo. She and Julien together ensure that family expenses are covered. At the Ouando market, Cica Bernadette sells cloth, shoes, insulated containers, and bowls. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, is where she goes to stock up on these different items. She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which she has repaid. She is requesting this third loan to expand her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, and handbags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a larger variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Aymara Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Aymara”, con 13 integrantes, están juntas hace aproximadamente 4 años, una de las integrantes es Sofía de 45 años, casada y tiene 6  hijos, ella se dedica al tejido de chompas de algodón y dice “…antes me compraba por libras y era difícil conseguir, pero ahora con la ayuda del préstamo puedo comprar al por mayor y rebajar mis costos..”, vende sus productos a clientes potenciales que le vienen a comprar a su domicilio y éstos los venden en Potosí, Villazón y Desaguadero. Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de alimento seco, refrescos, verduras. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
In Pro Mujer's Focus Center "Panamericana" is located the "Aymara" Communal Association which is made up of 13 members who have been together for apporxomately 4 years. One of the members is Sofia, 45, married and the mother of 6 children. She knits cotton skirts and states: "...I used to buy by the pound which was difficult to get but now, with the help of the loan, I can buy wholesale and cut my costs...". She sells to potential customers who come to her home to buy and these then resell them in Potosí, Villazón y Desaguadero. The other members have their own businesses such as the sale of dry food stuffs, beverages, vegetables. They all need the loan in order supply their businesses with merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 28 years old and is married with three children aged between 8 months and 5 years. He lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where he has had a shop since 1999. He employs one person in his shop, which is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Innocent is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing a greater variety of goods for sale.

By receiving and using this loan, Innocent hopes to improve his offerings to his customers and attract additional customers. If he is successful, the increased profits will help him to pay school fees and provide more, and better, food for his children. In addition, he hopes to help his community by bringing more high quality goods closer to them at the cheapest prices he is able to provide.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is 46 years old and she is married with four children. She sells frozen foods and kerosene. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and she says that the loan will go a long way to lift her business above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey T. is 33 years old and is married with two children. He lives in Northern Province, Rwanda, three hours drive from the capital city of Kigali.

A true entrepreneur, Jean Marie Vianey has had his shop for the past five years and it is operating successfully. His business is open from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Jean Marie Vianey is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company to use as general working capital and to expand his business by purchasing more variety of inventory for his shop. With that expansion, Jean Marie Vianey hopes to change the life of his family for the better.

loans.use: To use as working capital and to add variety to his inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan E. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntualmente, esta solicitando un préstamo para poder empezar la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta alta de la vivienda. 
Don Juan es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos a los cuales les quiere dar lo mejor, una de las cosas es darles su propio espacio en la casa, para ellos san las dos recamaras que quiere construir. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabaja como gerente de una farmacia.
 La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora María De Jesús Gómez ya que el señor Juan se encontraba en su trabajo el día del la visita.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan E. has had two previous loans with FVP that were repaid on time. He is requesting a new loan so that he can begin construction of two rooms on the top floor of his house.

Don Juan is the father of two children and he desires to provide them with the best. One of the things he wants to give them is their own space in the house, so he would like to build two bedrooms for them.

He plans to repay the loan using the income from his job as a pharmacy manager. The person who appears in the photo is his wife, Sra. María De Jesús Gómez. Don Juan was at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build two bedrooms for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build more rooms in his lodge and buy more cows for his dairy

loans.name: Okunola

texts.en: V. is 51 years old and married with four children. She is into the rentals service business. She has been in the business for the past five years. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more chairs and tables to rent. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to rent.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a 58-year-old borrower from San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He has five children, but the youngest is already 28 and all have moved out of his home, where he lives with his wife. This is Miguel’s first individual loan, and his seventh loan overall with Esperanza. He is excited for the responsibility of having an individual loan, and is thankful for the opportunity this loan will provide. Miguel runs a colmado in his neighborhood, which is a small corner store that can sell anything from juices to laundry detergent. Miguel sells juice, rice, beans, flour, household items, and even makes sandwiches in his colmado. 

Miguel dreams to one day own his home, eventually allowing him to leave something behind for his children. With an individual loan, Miguel is now solely responsible for the outcome of his finances. He hopes that his profits will greatly increase with the ability to more easily dictate how much he borrows and how he uses it in his colmado. These financial changes will bring him more success and profit, bringing him that much closer to his dream. Thank you for lending to Miguel and his colmado!

loans.use: To buy food and drinks for his corner store

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is 40 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she does hair for her customers and she also sells drinks and gift items. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and gift items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and gift items

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a widow with three children aged 14, 7 and 4. Apart from her children, Zainab has one dependent.

Zainab rents a store at a strategic location in the eastern part of Freetown where ships berth. She sells rice and pillet (pig feed) and has built up her business for about eight years.

As Zainab is the one fending for the family, she is hoping to use the loan to buy more rice and pillet. She intends to use part of the proceeds to run the home and to rent a much bigger shop space.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and feed

loans.name: I. A. Isabelle

texts.fr: G. I. A. Isabelle est née en 1971 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Isabelle est mariée à AKPODE Edouard, un agent de la Société Béninoise d’Eau et d’Electricité (SBEE). Isabelle et Edouard ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Louho à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Isabelle et Edouard assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Isabelle vend à son domicile des divers (sucre, biscuits, papiers hygiéniques, chaussures, piles, pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, etc.) ainsi que des boissons de la Brasserie et de la glace. Isabelle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Isabelle sollicite ce troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Isabelle A. G. was born in 1971 at Cotonou, the business capital of Benin. Isabelle is married to Edouard Akpode an employee of the Beninoise Water and Electricity Company. Isabelle and Edouard have four children who have attended school and are still in their care. The family lives in Louho in Porto-Novo the administrative capital of Benin. Isabelle and Edouard together, meet the needs of the family. Isabelle sells from her house assorted items such as sugar, biscuits, toilet paper, shoes, batteries, meat spreads, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatoes, etc. She also sells beer and ice. Isabelle has already benefited from loans that she has made with ALIde, loans that she has duly repaid. She is requesting this third loan to strengthen her business operating funds.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies of  sugar, biscuits, toilet paper, shoes, batteries, meat spreads, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatoes, etc for resale

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: H. Agnès est née en 1971 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Agnès est mariée à ADOUEKONOU Médard, un chauffeur. Agnès et Médard ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Dowa à Porto-Novo. Agnès vend du charbon de bois qu’elle attache en petits lots dans des sachets. Agnès vend aussi de boisson locale et des beignets faits à base de farine de blé. C’est à domicile que Agnès vend ces produits. Mais, Agnès s’approvisionne en ces produits au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo. Agnès a eu deux crédits de ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursés. Agnès sollicite ce troisième crédit de ALIDé pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Agnes Houdenou was born in 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Agnes is married to Menard Adouekonou, a driver. Agnes and Menard have four children who have all attended school and are still in their care. The family lives in Dowa in Porto-Nova. Agnes sells charcoal which she packages in small bags. She also sells local drinks and doughnuts made from a corn flour base. Agnes sells her products from her home. She buys her supplies at the market in Porto-Novo. Agnes has had two previous loans with ALIDe which she has duly repaid. Agnes is requesting this third loan from ALIDe to increase her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn flour and charcoal as well as crates of local drinks for resale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience B. sells jewelry and clothes in Kwamikrom. Patience has received a junior high education. She is married and has three children. Patience has been selling jewelry and clothes since 2003. She helps her husband in footing the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry and clothes for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sergio Mario

texts.es:
El señor Sergio R. vive actualmente en el municipio de Nagarote en el departamento de León y se ha desempeñado como albañil en la construcción de viviendas siendo esta actividad la que le permite obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares.

El señor Sergio ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su propia vivienda para brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno y para ello remodelará partes de la vivienda por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así llevar a cabo su obra y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio R. lives in the municipality of Nagarote in the town of León, and works as a mason in the construction of houses. This allows him to support his family, composed of his spouse and two school-aged children. Mr. Sergio has started to improve conditions in his own home to give his children a proper roof. He will renovate parts of the house, which is why he asks for the loan for the purchase of construction materials in order to carry out his work and benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Banco Comunal De Juntos A Trabajar Group

texts.en:
The group consists of 11 neighbors who live in San Sebastián, a neighborhood in Cusco.  The group is called Juntos a Trabajar, which means We Work Together. The members are natives of Cusco and surrounding areas.

Some of the members are single, some have children and others are single.

The members are engaged in various commercial activities – construction, grocery, selling jewelry, clothing, fresh juice, and cellular phones.

With this loan, they will invest in more construction materials and products for their stores.  One will repair a car  to rent and another will open a new store selling piñatas for children’s birthday parties.
 
For some this is their first loan, while others have received loans in the past.

All of the members are grateful for the loans, especially since some have had problems obtaining capital in the past.  They all promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(Erica is not pictured in the photo)

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Silvia Yessenia

texts.es: Silvia Yessenia C. G. reside en San José Villanueva en el departamento de La Libertad. Silvia tiene 29 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija Andrea de 5 años de edad. Silvia posee su propio negocio con tan solo dos año de experiencia, donde vive Silvia en San José Villanueva es un pequeño cantón donde no hay muchos comercio, ventajas que le permiten mantener sus ventas estables; a pesar que Silvia y su esposo invirtieron sus ahorros para poner su negocio no alcanzaron a cubrir productos necesarios y de gran demanda por sus clientes, es por eso que solicita de un crédito que utilizara para comprar nueva mercadería para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Yessenia C. G. lives in San José Villanueva in the department of La Libertad. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and their daughter Andrea, who is 5 years old. Silvia has managed her business with only two years of experience. San José Villanueva is a small town with few businesses, an advantage that allows Silvia to have steady sales.

Silvia and her husband have invested their savings into their business, so they are not able to buy basic necessities and other products highly demanded by their customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise in order to keep her business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Reina Marina

texts.es: Reina Marina P. D. N. D. 55 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Reina  es una mujer divorciada,  actualmente se encuentra viviendo sola, tiene una hija pero vive en Estados Unidos. Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora ha dedicado casi la mitad D. su vida a este negocio, un comedor D. comida cacera en el mercado D. Usulután, son ya 22 años a cargo D. su negocio. Reina posee una clientela permanente, por ella solicita D. un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad D. bebidas para ofrecer a sus clientes y diversos productos desechables para vender sus platillos D. comida.
texts.en:
Reina Marina P. D. N. is 55 years old and lives in the department of Sonsonate. She is divorced and currently lives by herself. Her only daughter lives in the United States. Reina is a hardworking woman who has dedicated almost half of her life to her business, a diner located near the Usulután Market. She has managed her business for 22 years.

Reina has regular customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of soft drinks and various disposable products used for selling her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & supplies for her diner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and charcoal as well as local beverages

loans.name: Jose Sabino

texts.es:
El microempresario José Sabino P. M. tiene 50 años de edad, es de la etnia miskita, es casado tiene dos hijos adolescentes que se encuentran estudiando en nivel secundario. El artesano P. quien es de la etnia miskita, se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a trabajar el palo de rosa con el cual realiza imágenes de personas, animales, barcos, etc.

Esta actividad por lo general es ofertada en ferias, en el aeropuerto y en lugares públicos que son visitados por la población y por turistas nacionales e internacionales, sin embargo no existe apoyo ni del gobierno ni de otras instancias para financiar esta actividad, porque no es un producto que se vende todos los días, sino que depende las actividades sociales, culturales y económicas que se realizan en la ciudad.

En artesano M. esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

200 pies de madera de palo de rosa el cual compra a US 1 dólar cada pie, 2 paquetes de lijas para la madera cada paquete cuesta US 12 dólares, 6 unidades de pasta para darle brillo al producto vales US 6 dólar cada unidad y 10 hojas de seguetas las que valen US 4 dólares cada una.
texts.en:
José Sabino P. M. is a micro-entrepreneur and a member of the Miskito ethnic group. He is 50 years old, married, and has two teenage children who are high school students. For over 15 years, José has been producing carvings that are made of rosewood and in the image of people, animals, boats, etc.

He sells his creations at fairs, at the airport, and in public places that are frequented by local residents and tourists, both domestic and international. However, José does not receive support from either the government or other organizations to help finance his artistic endeavors because his products are not the type that are sold every day. His sales depend on the social, cultural, and economic climate within the city.

José is requesting a loan to finance the following purchases: • 200 ft. of rosewood timber at $1 USD/ft. • 2 packages of sandpaper that cost $12 USD each • 6 units of paste used for polishing finished products that cost $6 USD/unit • 10 saw blades that cost $4 USD each

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for producing wood carvings

loans.name: Alberto Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Alberto Jesús C. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos los cuales han sido para la construcción de su casa.
Nueva mente esta solicitando un préstamo para  terminar la construcción de su vivienda  y así dejar de pagar renta y que su familia tenga un lugar seguro donde vivir, ya que desea que sus dos hijas tengan su propio casa. 
Planea pagar crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como supervisor de ventas.
texts.en:
Alberto Jesús C. has already had four loans, which have been for the construction of his house. He is again asking for a loan to finish the construction on his house. That way he can stop paying rent, and his family will have a safe place to live. He wants his two daughters to have their own home. He plans to repay the loan with the income he gets from his employment as a sales supervisor.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on his house (foundation and walls)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula L. M. tiene 57 años, su negocio es una humilde pulpería, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar por cuenta propia para ayuda a su familia. Por lo que realiza las compras de los diferentes productos en el mercado, algunas veces es que llegan a dejarle los productos a su pulpería. Ella tiene una de las principales pulpería en su comarca y ofrece sus productos a un precio favorable para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, jugos, refrescos, pan, galletas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Paula L. M., 57, has a humble mini-market. She has had this business for over four years. Her business is located in her home. She has always liked working on her own to help her family. She buys the different products in the market. Sometimes they come to leave the products in her mini-market. She has one of the main mini-markets in her region. She sells her products at a favorable price in order to have more customers. The loan she is asking for is to buy basic grains, juice, soft drinks, bread, and crackers among other things. Her wish is to make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells bags of maize in Kwamikrom. Mary has received a junior high education. She is married and has four dependants. She is responsible for payment of the utility bills and providing food for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more of the bags of maize to be distributed to her customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more of the bags of maize

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: H. Constance est née en 1975 à Abomey-Calavi au Sud du Bénin. Constance est mariée à SENOU Ludovic, un gendarme. Constance et Ludovic ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Djassin à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Constance et Ludovic assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Constance vend du pain au collège de Djassin. Constance vend aussi des divers (pâtes alimentaires ; boîtes de mayonnaises, tomate, sardines, lait ; du sucre ; des savons ; etc.). Constance achète ses produits à Ouando à Porto-Novo. Constance a eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour son activité. Constance a bien remboursé ses crédits. Constance sollicite un autre crédit pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
H. Constance was born in 1975 in Abomey-Calavi in the south of Bénin. Constance is married to SENOU Ludovic, a gendarme. Constance and Ludovic have three children, all in school and all still under their care. The family lives in Djassin in Porto-Novo, Administrative Capital of Bénin.

Constance and Ludovic share in supporting their family. Constance sells bread at the high school in Djassin. Constance also sells varous other items (pasta, jars of mayonnaise, tins of tomatoes, sardines, milk; sugar and soap, etc.) She buys her products in Ouando in Porto-Novo.

Constance has received two loans from ALIDé for her business. She has reimbursed these loans in a timely manner. She is requesting another loan so that she can develop her business further.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pasta, mayonnaise, tins of tomatoes, sardines, milk, etc. for resale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Sonia J. le está haciendo falta un cuarto de lavado, porque el que tiene actual mente es de madero y esta en muy malas condiciones y teme que le pueda pasar algo. 
Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar el material y a la persona que le realizara la mejora. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder construir su cuarto de lavado. Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su pensión ya que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Sonia J.’s house does not have a washroom. The one it currently has is made of wood, and it is in very bad condition. She is afraid that something could happen to it. At this time she does not have the necessary money to pay for the material and the person to make the improvement. That is why she is asking for a loan to build a washroom. She plans to repay the loan with the income she gets from her pension because her children help her with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a washroom

loans.name: Laurel

texts.en:
A professional chef since 1994, Laurel knows what her female colleagues in the kitchen need: appropriately-sized professional chef uniforms. "The typical chef's jacket is cut for a man. The sleeves are too long and the fit is terrible," says Laurel.

After receiving business coaching from a local resource center and interning in pattern-making at an apparel company, Laurel developed her business plan and launched Bayleaf Design Company in 2007. She continues her work as a part-time caterer and even sells sandwiches and salads to a café near her home to make ends meet as her business gets off the ground.  

Her full line of chef’s apparel is currently in production with the manufacturer and Laurel is hitting the trade show circuit this fall to pre-sell her products.  A female chef who is currently competing on a national television cooking competition already wears one of Laurel’s earliest designs. “When I talked to her about my designs, she got excited that I was finally making what every female chef knows we so desperately need!”

A $2,000 loan will allow Laurel to buy a new computer and a mobile credit card scanner to process orders at trade shows. “The timing is right and I have wonderful momentum. The food service industry is adapting to the down economy and people are still working in restaurants. It’s so exciting to see my business taking off!”

loans.use: Computer and mobile credit card scanner

loans.name: Edmonde

texts.fr: K. Edmonde est née en 1974 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Edmonde est mariée à ANASSOU Hounhoui. Edmonde et Hounhoui ont six enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Avakpa à Porto-Novo. Edmonde vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires ; biscuits ; boîtes de sucres, de lait, de tomate, de sardines ; des savons ; des papiers hygiéniques, etc.) et du gasoil. C’est Ikpinlè à la frontière bénino-nigériane que Edmonde s’approvisionne en gasoil. Edmonde est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Edmonde a bien remboursé ses crédits et sollicite un autre pour élever le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
K. Edmonde was born in 1974 in Porto-Novo, Administrative Capital of Bénin. Edmonde is married to ANASSOU Hounhoui. Edmonde and Hounhoui have six children, all enrolled in school, four of whom are still their responsibility. The family lives in Avakpa in Porto-Novo. Edmonde sells various items (pasta, cookies, tins of sugar, milk, tomatoes, sardines; soap, toilet paper, etc.) and diesel fuel. She gets her diesel fuel at Ikpinlè on the Benin-Nigeria border.

Edmonde is on her third loan with ALIDé. She reimbursed her previous loans in a timely manner and is requesting another to bolster her little business. .

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of diesel and various items for resale

loans.name: Mahussi Victoire

texts.fr: K. Mahussi Victoire est née en 1981. Victoire est mariée à ATCHOU Pierre. Victoire et Pierre ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge dont deux sont les leurs. La famille vit à Djassin à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Victoire et Pierre assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. C’est du gasoil que Victoire vend à domicile. Victoire va s’approvisionner en gasoil au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin. Victoire ne dispose pas de moyens financiers suffisants pour couvrir la demande de sa clientèle. Alors, Victoire sollicite ce prêt de ALIDé pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Mahussi Victoire was born in 1981.  She is married to ATCHOU Pierre.  She and Pierre support three children who are all in school. Two of the children are theirs. The family lives in Djassin in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  Victoire and Pierre together ensure that family expenses are covered.  Victoire sells diesel fuel at home.  To stock up on it, she goes to Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  She lacks sufficient financial means to meet customer demands.  And so she's requesting this ALIDé loan, as to be more responsive to them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of fuel oil

loans.name: Blanche

texts.fr: K. Blanche est née en 1982 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Blanche est mariée à ZOUHO Crépin, un couturier. Blanche et Crépin ont un seul enfant, scolarisé et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Djassin à Porto-Novo. Blanche et Crépin assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Blanche a seulement fait le cours primaire mais elle a fini par aussi faire une formation en coiffure qu’elle exerce actuellement. En plus de la coiffure, Blanche vend dans son salon, des produits cosmétiques et certains produits de grande consommation. C’est à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin que Blanche s’approvisionne en ses différents produits. Blanche a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits de ALIDé pour son activité. Blanche a bien remboursés ces crédits et sollicite un autre pour continuer de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Blanche was born in 1982 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to ZOUHO Crépin, a clothing designer.  She and Crépin have one child in school who they still support.  The family lives in Djassin in Porto-Novo.  Blanche and Crépin together ensure that family expenses are covered.  Blanche has completed only primary school but also ended up completing training in hairdressing, which she currently works in.  Beyond hairdressing, she sells in her salon certain high-volume goods and cosmetics.  Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, is where she stocks up on these different goods.  Blanche has benefited before from two ALIDé loans for her business and has repaid them.  She's requesting another one to continue to respond effectively to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and highly-consumed products

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
ALCOM JEHOVA JIREH

La Alcom Jehova Jireh son muy unidos y puntuales en sus pagos, eso lo demuestran en su historial crediticio. La Sra YOLANDA es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 hijos que gracias a su esfuerzo ya son independientes a pesar que estuvo separada del esposo por 16 años. Ella inicio su negocio a consecuencia de un problema de salud, le detectaron Diabetes y Osteoporosis, le recomendaron tomar  productos “naturales”, los consumió y en poco tiempo pudo notar muchos cambios, estos cambios también lo notaron sus familiares y amigos, es ahí donde empieza a comentar de las bondades de ese tipo de productos e inicia la venta. 

Ahora se siente muy contenta con su negocio porque gracias a ello pudo  mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y ayudar a sus hijos. Ahora es distribuidora independiente tanto local como a provincia;  realiza reuniones en su casa  denominadas  “el club de nutrición”. 

Con el préstamo obtenido, lo invertirá en comprar  diferentes productos “naturales”, de esta forma podrá atender mejor sus pedidos; pero por encima de todo, su  objetivo primordial es “mejorar la salud a otras personas”; Es por ello  que recomienda a sus compañeras a poder iniciarse en este tipo de negocio ya que sabe que con mucha perseverancia se puede alcanzar cada uno de los objetivos y metas.
texts.en:
The Alcom Jehova Jireh are a very unified and punctual with repayments group, which is clearly demonstrated in their credit history. Yolanda is the group president. She has three children who, thanks to her efforts, are all now independent despite her being separated from her husband for 16 years. She began her business as a result of a health problem; she was diagnosed with diabetes and osteoporosis for which they recommended she take "natural" products. She began taking them and soon noticed several changes. Her family and friends noticed them, too. This is where she realized the benefits of these kinds of products. Now, she is happy with her work because she was able to improve her house's infrastructure and help her children. She is an independent distributor, both at the local and at the provincial level. She chairs meetings, called the "nutrition club", in her home. With the loan she intends to buy various "natural" products with which to better fill her orders but, above all, her main goal is to "improve others' health". This is the reason she encourages her teammates to get involved in this kind of business since she knows that, with perseverance, one can reach each and every objective and goal.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: María Lucinda

texts.es:
María tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive desde hace siete meses junto a sus tíos en el caserío Santa Isabel, distrito de Mórrope, a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

En marzo de este año terminó de estudiar la carrera de cosmetología en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo; fue entonces cuando decidió empezar a buscar su propio sustento y viajó hasta la zona en donde vive actualmente para iniciar su propio negocio: ella tiene una pequeña peluquería que funciona en casa de sus tíos.

Su peluquería tiene medio año funcionando y durante este tiempo se ha ido haciendo conocida no sólo entre los vecinos del caserío en donde vive sino que también entre las personas que viven en caseríos colindantes, las cuales acuden hasta el lugar a solicitar su servicio.

María siente que ha llegado la hora de hacer crecer su negocio y empezar a equiparlo con los instrumentos necesarios para dar a sus clientes un servicio de mejor calidad, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de rasuradoras eléctricas, secadoras, tintes, espejos y una silla especial.

Ella es una joven muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos del lugar los cuales la admiran por su responsabilidad y sus ganas de supèración. María tiene proyectado seguir creciendo y tener un local propio en donde pueda atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old, single, and has lived for the past seven months with her uncles in the Santa Isabel village, district of Mórrope, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. March of this year she finished her studies in cosmetology at a technical institute in the city of Chiclayo; it was then that she decided to start looking for a way to support herself and traveled to the area that she currently lives to start her own business. She owns a small hair salon that she runs in her uncles’ house. Her hair salon has been running for half a year and during this time she has become well-known not only amongst the neighbors of the village where she lives, but also amongst the people that live in neighboring villages who travel to her business to request her services. Maria feels that the time has arrived for her to expand her business and to begin to furnish it with the necessary equipment to provide her clients with a higher quality service. It is because of this that she finds herself requesting for the first time a loan of 1000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to invest in the purchase of electric shavers, hair dryers, dyes, mirrors, and a special chair. She is a very well known young woman and well regarded by her neighbors that admire her for being responsible and her drive to get ahead in life. Maria has plans to continue growing and to have her own locale where she can attend to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment to furnish her hair salon.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio T. Menedez tiene 56 años, casado y tiene 7 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. 3 hijos y 2 nietos viven en su casa. El trabaja en su propia campo, cultivando cafe y mantiendo pasto para las vaccas. Su esposa y 7 hijos trabajan en la misma finca. El quiere comprar uno mas ganado para leche y despues para carne. Es el primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este prestamo. El ha tendido crédito con Banco Costa Rica hace muchos anos pero prefiere los prestamos de FUDECOSUR porque son más baratos. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable.
texts.en:
Patricio T. Menedez is 56 years old, married and has 7 children who are his main priority. Three of his children and two of his grandchildren live in his house. He works on his own land cultivating coffee and maintaining a pasture for his cattle. His wife and 7 children work on the same farm. He wants to buy another cow that he will use for milk and then later for meat. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he believes that he will be able to increase his business with this loan. He has had a loan from the Banco Costa Rica for many years but he prefers the loans from FUDECOSUR because they are more affordable. He wishes to provide his wife and children with a better and more stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es: Andrés M. F. tiene 19 años, soltero, y vive con su madre y 5 hermanos. Su familia tiene una finca y ellos cultivan cafe y matienen pasto. Todo la familia trabaja en la finca y su madre tiene una pulpería. Ahora ellos no estan usando el pasto entonces él quiere un prestamo para crecer y mejorar la finca. Las vaccas son para carne y quisiera a continuar comprando y vendiendo vaccas para apoyar sus hermanos y los 9 hijos de sus hermanos. Es su primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR pero su madre ha tenido un otro prestamo de FUDECOSUR para la pulpería. La hermana de Andrés es la sectretaría del comité y esta aparecido en la foto.
texts.en:
Andrés M. F. is 19 years old, single and lives with his mother and 5 siblings. His family has a farm and then grow coffee and maintain a pasture. The whole family works on the farm and his mother has a grocery story. Now they are not using the pasture, so he wants a loan to grow and improve the land. The cows are for meat and he wants to continue to buy and sell cows to support his siblings and his 9 nieces and nephews. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, but his mother has had another loan from the same institution for her grocery store. Andrés' sister is the secretary of the commission and appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 cattle

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a 34-year-old borrower who lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. This is Daniela’s first individual loan, and fourth overall with Esperanza International. She has a perfect repayment record, and she is excited for the challenge of having a loan for which she is solely responsible.

Daniela runs a beauty salon in her neighborhood here in San Pedro, which she rents on a monthly basis. She specializes in hairstyling and coloring, and also gives manicures and pedicures. Daniela will be using her loan to purchase new hair and nail products, shampoos, creams, and perfumes. She hopes these will lead to happier customers, better business, and greater profits.

Daniela likes the detailed attention she receives from Esperanza. She has never had a problem working with her loans, and she hopes to continue borrowing in order to have a better future for her business. One day, she would like to own both her business and her home. Thank you for lending to Daniela and her beauty salon!

loans.use: To purchase hair and nail products

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor H. R. S. is 40 years old and married with a 16-month-old daughter. He has a small farm that he tends and he also works on a neighboring coffee farm. He has some available pasture and so would like to use it for cows. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and will be his first experience raising his own cattle. He dreams that his daughter might go to college one day and would like to improve his farm to facilitate that. He has never had loans with other banks, as they were prohibitively expensive.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: Amelia Elena

texts.es: Amelia Elena M. R. reside en Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Amelia tiene 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija. Para Amelia ha sido muy difícil sacr su negocio adelnate ya que empezó con poca mercadería en su tienda y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su inventario son cinco años los que Amelia lleva a cargo de su negocio, pero ahora ella solicta de un crédito el cual le ayude a solidificar las bases de su tienda surtiéndola de variedad de mercadería que le permita que sus clientes compren todo lo que necesitan en su negocio.
texts.en:
Amelia Elena M. R. resides in Colon in the La Libertad region. Amelia is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. For Amelia it has been very difficult to move her business forward since she began with very little merchandise in her store. Over the five years that Amelia has been in charge of the business, she has increased the merchandise little by little. Now she is requesting a loan that will help her to solidify the foundation of her store by supplying it with a variety of merchandise that will allow her customers to buy everything they need from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her store with merchandise

loans.name: Minsito

texts.fr: Minsito T., 58 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" depuis 3 ans.Elle développe une activité de vente de glace, de crème glacée et de tissu teinté. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle participe activement à la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
Minsito T., aged 58, is married and the mother of three children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years.  She is developing a business selling ice, ice cream, and dyed cloth.  With her profits, she actively helps to feed the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 30-year-old borrower from San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. This is Roberto’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and he is very excited to get started. Roberto lives in one of the poorest neighborhoods of San Pedro with his wife and son. Their home lacks water and electricity, but that has not stopped Roberto from finding a place to use his skills.

Roberto is an experienced tailor of men’s clothing. He specializes in the manufacture of underwear, but also offers his services for other types of clothing. He will use this loan to purchase fabric and sewing supplies, and to rent the space that he uses to work. He hopes that with more access to capital, he will now be able to expand his line of products and reach a greater amount of people.

Roberto dreams to one day own his own business where he can make his own hours and hire employees to help in his shop. He would like to have a full men’s clothing store, offering everything from head to toe. With his extra profits, Roberto also hopes to secure a good education for his son, ensuring that he can grow up and work hard to become a professional just like his dad. Thank you for your loan to Roberto and his tailoring business!

loans.use: To buy supplies for the production of clothing

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela C. D. G. resiD. en Sacacoyo en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas Estela D. 16 años D. edad y Lidia D. 13 años D. edad. Blanca lleva once años D. administrar y trabajar diariamente en su negocio su comedor ubicado en la carretera que conduce a Sonsonate que lleva por nombre “Comedor Estelita”, Blanca goza D. una clientela muy estable, pero últimamente la producción D. su comedor no ha alcanzado con la demanda D. clientes que vistan el lugar, es por ello que solicita D. un crédito para comprar cereales, verduras y otros insumos para la cocina.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela C. D. G. lives in Sacacoyo in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and her two daughters, 16-year-old Estela and 12-year-old Lidia.
