Blanca has been working daily for 11 years in her restaurant business which is located on the freeway o the way to Sonsonate. It is called Estelita Restaurant, and Blanca has a stable clientele. However, recently her restaurant's production has not been able to match the clients' high demand, and she wants to buy grains, vegetables and other ingredients for the kitchen with the the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to increase production

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin R. S. is 47 years old and is married with three children who are his first priority. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy two pigs. Right now, he doesn't have any pigs but would like to earn more income for his family by raising some. He currently works on a neighboring farm harvesting coffee. This is his first loan with Fudecosur and is excited to have a village bank in his community as he never had other sources of credit available to him. His dreams for his family are to continue moving forward in the right direction.

loans.use: To buy two pigs

loans.name: Mayela

texts.en: Mayela M. Mauera is a 50-year-old married woman with five grown children who are still her first priority. She lives with her husband; her children have moved to Cartago, about three hours away. Mayela runs a general clothing store with her husband and needs a loan to buy more stock, specifically clothes and shoes. The store is located in a room in her house facing the street. She also has a small farm where she grows coffee and raises pigs. Previously she had a loan with Banco Nacional but this loan was more expensive than FUDECOSUR. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she hopes it will help her grow her business to support her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for the store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou est une femme de 58 ans, elle est veuve et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2 depuis 3 ans et tous les prêts qu'elle a reçu ont été toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle commercialise du tissu et de l'encens. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle assure la nourriture de ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 58-year-old woman and a widow with four children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years. All the loans she received were always repaid without a problem. With her current, loan she is marketing fabrics and incense. With the profits she makes, she ensures that her four children are fed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her micro-enterprise

loans.name: Jose Salomon

texts.es: José Salomón tiene 50 años, a su edad ha logrado trabajar lo suficiente para ayudar a su familia. Su actividad económica es venta y elaboración de mochilas. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, el dio inicio a este negocio por su familia ya que su Papa le había enseñado este medio de vida, para que ganara algo de dinero y pudiera mantener a su familia. Actualmente el trabaja muy duro todos los días ya que después tiene venderlas en los diferentes departamentos. El sueño de José es tener su propio taller en donde obtenga mayor producción. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de cuero, tela, zipper y agujas.
texts.en:
José Salomón is 50 years old and and, at this age, has worked enough to be able to help his family. He makes and sells backpacks or satchels . He has been involved in this activity for over 15 years since his father taught him how to earn his livelihood through this type of work. His goal was to make enough money to support his family. Currently he must work very hard every day because after making them he has to go sell them in different departments. His dream is to have his own workshop where he can increase his production. The financing he is requesting will be used as working capital which will be invested in the purchase of leather, fabric, zippers, and sewing needles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Raquel De Los Ángeles M. M. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Raquel tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando. El esposo de Raquel se dedica a las ventas de manera ambulante y genera aproximadamente $250.00 US mensuales los cuales son utilizados para costos fijos del hogar, Raquel por su lado apoya por medio de las ganancias obtenidas de su librería, la cual  tiene instalada en su lugar de domicilio. Raquel solicita un crédito para compra nuevos productos para su librería.
texts.en:
Raquel De Los Ángeles lives in the La Libertad department, is 31 years old, and lives with her husband and two children, who are students. Raquel's husband is an itinerant salesman who earns about 250.00 dollars US per month which go towards paying the household's fixed costs. Raquel, for her part, helps out with the profits she earns in her bookstore which is installed in her home. Raquel is asking for a loan to buy new products for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her bookstore.

loans.name: Mansita

texts.fr: Mansita K., est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et coépouse (2ème femme) elle a 5 enfants et membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 ans. Avec son crédit elle achète des rouleaux de tissu et des bobines de fils pour confectionner et vendre des draps de lit, elle fabrique aussi artisanalement de l'encens elle exporte vers les pays étrangers. Elle contribue beaucoup au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mansita K. is a 53-year-old woman.  She is married and is a co-spouse (the second wife).  She has five children and has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years.  With her current loan, she buys rolls of cloth and spools of thread to make bedsheets to sell. She also makes incense by hand that she exports to foreign countries.  She does a lot to help her family's well-being. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria R. D.
texts.en:
Victoria lives in Old Cuscatlán which is a municipality in the La Libertad department. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband and her three adult children, all of whom are economically independent. Despite the financial help she gets from her children, she is a very hard working woman who can't imagine ever leaving her business which she has guided and seen grow and which now is very much in demand. She sells pupusas (a kind of stuffed corn dumpling) which are in high demand by the inhabitants of the town because the neighborhood where Victoria lives is well known for the variety of pupusas that can be found there. Weekends are Victoria's highest selling days and she is requesting this loan in order to purchase ingredients which will allow her to continue to produce her pupusas without having to face the inconvenience caused by running out of supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make pupusas (a kind of stuffed corn dumpling).

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.es: Oscar Alonso Martínez tiene 35 años de edad, es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad económica es una panadería la cual surge como una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia. Este le ha permitido mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y brindarle un trabajo a su esposa en el mismo hogar lo que permite estar al cuidado de los niños el mayor tiempo posible, pero han  sufrido mucho con el alza de los precios en los productos ya que la harina  es indispensable para la elaboración del pan. Por esto es que solicita a Fundación León 2000 un financiamiento de manera que le permita comprar productos por mayor a un menor precio y así ofrecerles a sus clientes un precio justo. Los deseos de Oscar son aumentar sus ventas y mantener el núcleo familiar estable en todos los ámbitos.
texts.en:
Oscar Alonso Martínez is 35 years old, married, and has two young children. His business is a bakery, which is a new source of income for his family. It has allowed him to improve his quality of life a little, and offers a job to his wife in the same house, which allows her to care for the children for the most time possible. But they have suffered a lot with the rise in prices of the products, since the flour is essential for making of bread. For this reason, he is requesting from Fundación León 2000 financing in a way that will allow him to buy products in bulk at a lower price, and as such offer his customers a fair price. Oscar´s wishes are to increase his sales and maintain the stable family core in all environments.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides tiene 47 años, casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tiene 23, 25 y 27 años y no viven en su casa ya no. Se negocio es ganado. El compra el ganado cuando sea joven y vende cuando sea gordo. Ahora tiene 7 ganado pero la gustaría mas. El esta aquilando pasto que es suficiente para 10 vaccas entonces el piense que debería crecer su finca. Es su primer prestamo con Fudecosur y prefiere los prestamos Fudecosures por que hay menos requistos que los bancos formales.
texts.en:
Alcides is 47 years old, married and has 3 children who are his first priority. His children are 23, 25, and 27 years old and they don´t live in his house anymore. His business is cattle. He buys the cattle when they are young and sells them when they are fat. Now he has 7 cattle but he would like more. He is renting a pasture that is sufficient for 10 cows, so he thinks that he should be able to grow his farm. It is his first loan with Fudecosur and he prefers the Fudecosur loans because they have fewer requisites than the formal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mariama Soukho

texts.fr: Mariama Soukho K. est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 ans. Elle a eu à y bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Avec son crédit elle fabrique et vend de la glace et de la crème glacée. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Soukho K. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children whom she supports.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years and has benefited from six loans, which she always repaid regularly.  With her current loan, she is making and selling ice and ice cream.  She contributes to improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel M. V. reside en Mejicanos en el departamento de San Salvador. Miguel tiene 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos de 21,20 y 16 años de edad, todos estudiantes. Miguel y su esposa trabajan para poder brindarle una educación superior a sus hijos quienes ahora se encuentran cursando la universidad y son el orgullo de esta pareja de padres. La esposa de Miguel se dedica a vender artículos de manera ambulante y Miguel da servicios de transporte a través de su taxi, la zona donde Miguel circula es muy transita y solicitada de su servicios, son ya nueve años los que lleva realizando dicha actividad. El solicita de un crédito para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y reparaciones menores que necesita ; ya que reconoce que su Taxi es su herramienta de trabajo y es de suma importancia mantenerlo en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel M. Vasquez resides in Mejicanos in the town of San Salvador. Miguel is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children of 21, 20 and 16 years of age, all students. Miguel and his wife work in order to provide a superior education to their children who are now in college and are a proud set of parents. Miguel's wife sells items on the street, and Miguel offers transport services with his taxi. The area where Miguel works is very busy, and so many people request his services. It has now been nine years since he has been doing that activity. He is requesting the loan to maintain his vehicle and complete needed minor repairs. Recognizing that his taxi is his means for work, it is very important to keep it in the best possible condition.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Vecinos Unidos Group

texts.es:
ALCOM VECINOS UNIDOS
El grupo se formo  hace aproximadamente 3 años. Ahora son 10 integrantes responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. La presidenta Sra. Marina es una persona trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo pudo construir una tienda que hasta hoy es su fuente D. ingreso.
La socia Saturnina se dedica a la venta D. pescado hace  mas D. 30 años, deseaba ayudar en casa así que empezó con este negocio, al principio tuvo muchos inconvenientes que poco a poco  pudo superarlos, con sus pequeños ingresos pudo aportar en casa y lo más importante para ella es la educación D. sus hijos.
Nelly es una D. las primeras socias  que empezó en el grupo, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida hace muchos años. Tiene  5  hijos quienes fueron educados con mucha dedicación,  ahora utilizara el crédito para la compra utensilios como ollas y platos para su negocio D. comida.
Actualmente están solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir mejorando sus negocios, los socios se dedican a la venta D. faros D. carro,  venta D. ropa a pedido,  venta D. zapatos y zapatillas, venta D. comida, y otros. Ellos desean invertir comprando productos D. mejor  calidad.
texts.en:
This group was formed approximately 3 years ago. It now has 10 members who are responsible and punctual with their payments. Sra. Marina is the group president. She is a hard worker who invested tremendous effort into building a store that provides her income to this day. Saturnina is a member who has been selling fish for more than 30 years. She wanted to help with the household expenses, so she started this business. Initially, Saturnina encountered many inconveniences but she gradually was able to overcome them. What is most important to her is providing her children with an education. Nelly was one of the first members who started the group. She has been selling food for many years. Nelly has 5 children who completed their schooling with great dedication. She will now use her loan to buy pots and dishes for her food business. The group is currently seeking a new loan to continue improving their businesses. The members sell car headlights, clothing by request, shoes, slippers, food, and other items. They want to acquire products of high quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products & supplies

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana Lucia P. C. reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Ana de 49 años de edad vive solo con cuatro hijos que aun son menores de edad y su esposo se encuentra en estado unidos. Ana lleva el gran peso de estar sola a cargo de sus cuatro hijos quienes dos de ellos se encuentran en etapa adolecente y los otros dos infantes, para Ana es difícil sustituir la figura paterna que sus hijos necesitan pero que lastimosamente se ha ido por darle un futuro mejor a la familia, ella hace lo mejor de sí ayudando a sus hijos y apodándolos en todo, son una familia muy unida  juntos trabajan en el negocio, una panadería que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, el crédito que solicita Ana es para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos con cuales logre aumentar su producción de pan y así poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia P. C. lives in the municipality of Soyango in the department of San Salvador. Forty-nine year old Ana lives alone with her four underage children since her husband is in the United States. Ana alone cares for her four children, two teenagers and two infants. It is difficult for Ana to provide the father figure role her children need but she knows her husband has left to pursue a better future for the family. She does her best raising and helping her children. They are a very close family and work together in Ana's business, a bakery that is run out of her home.

Ana is asking for a loan to purchase more ingredients that she can use to increase bread production and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Maria Lucrecia Narváez es una mujer casada y tiene 6 hijos todos son mayores de edad. La señora Maria tiene un negocio de compra-venta de joyas y ropa nueva los cuales distribuye por encargos principalmente. Hace más de 15 años de haber iniciado este negocio, el cual empezó debido a que su esposo es albañil y no ganaba lo suficiente para la manutención del hogar, por lo que ella tuvo que buscar fuentes alternativas para mejorar los ingresos del hogar y le ha ido bien desde entonces. El crédito será invertido en la compra de joyas y de ropa nueva, ya que se acercan las fechas de ventas buenas y ella desea aprovechar comprar en este momento en que los precios están bajos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda en la cual pueda vender sus joyas y ropa nueva variada, de tal forma que se la pueda heredar a sus hijos para que ellos mejoren su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Lucrecia N. is a married woman and has 6 sons, all who are adults. Mrs Maria has a business of buying and selling jewelry and new clothes, which mainly she distributes through orders. More than 15 years after starting this business, which she started because her husband is a mason and did not earn enough to support the household, she had to seek alternative sources to improve household income and it has gone well since then. The loan will be invested in the purchase of jewelry and new clothes. Since the sales season is approaching, she would like to make good purchases at this time when prices are low. Her dream is to have a store in which to sell her jewelry and various new clothes, so that it can be passed onto her children so that they improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and new clothes for sale

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Alimatou T. est une veuve âgée de 45 ans avec 4 enfants en charge, elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 trois ans. Elle y a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Avec son crédit elle fabrique de la glace et de la crème qu'elle revend. Elle vend également des tissus teintés. C'est elle qui assure la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Alimatou T. is a 45-year-old widow with four children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years and has benefited from six loans, which she repaid regularly.  With her current loan, she is making ice and cream that she sells retail.  She also sells dyed fabrics.  She is the one who ensures that her four children are provided with food, health care, and schooling. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her micro-enterprise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora Maritza C. tiene 49 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos, dos menores y uno que está estudiando en la universidad. La señora Maritza se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, juguetes y zapatos usados. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cobertores, sabanas, colchas y mosquiteros para la época que se acerca, ya que desea aprovechas los precios bajos de estas fechas. Es importante mencionar, que la señora además trabaja como enfermera en el hospital, y también allí ofrece sus mercancías a sus compañeros de trabajo. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza C. is 49 years old, is married with three children -- two young children and one who is studying at a university. Mrs. Maritza sells general merchandise, primarily clothing, toys and used shoes. 21 years ago when she started her business, she began with a small amount of capital and was saving little by little until she had enough clients. The loan will be invested in the purchase of blankets, sheets, quilts and mosquito nets during the upcoming season because she wants to take advantage of the low prices during this time. It is important to mention that the lady also works as a nurse in the hospital, and there she sells her merchandise to her fellow workers. Her goal is to have a variety store that can be maintained by members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blankets, sheets, quilts and mosquito nets for sale

loans.name: Mame Sophie

texts.fr: Mame Sophie C. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et a ses 5 neveux en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 ans. Avec son crédit elle fabrique et vend de la glace et crème, elle vend également du tissu. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Mame Sophie C. is a 53-year-old woman.  She is married and has her five nephews to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years.  With her current loan, she is making and selling cream and ice.  And she also sells cloth.  She participates in covering the day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her micro-enterprise

loans.name: Nicolás Antonio

texts.es: Nicolás Antonio P. E. de 61 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca municipio del departamento de La Paz. Nicolás vive en casa propia con su mama doña Julia de 90 años de edad. Nicolás es un hombre soltero nunca se caso, solo tuvo un hijo que ahora se encuentra en Estados Unidos. Nicolás cuida de su madre quien por su edad necesita de muchas atenciones,  es por ello que Nicolás ha buscado la manera de generar ingresos sin salir de su casa, para así cuidar el mismo de su madre ya que los costos de una enfermera no están a su alcance, por el momento Nicolás administra su negocio una tienda de productos de consumo diario y es la misma que ahora desea surtir por medio de este crédito.
texts.en:
Nicolás Antonio is 61 years old and lives in the municipality of Zacatecoluca which is in the La Paz department. He lives in his own home with his mother, doña Julia, 90. Nicolás is single, he was never married but did have a son who lives in the United States. Nicolás cares for his mother who, due to her advanced age, requires a lot of attention. This is the reason why Nicolás has sought ways to generate income without having to leave his house so that he himself can care for his mother since the cost of hiring a nurse is beyond his means. For the moment, Nicolás runs a general store and requests funding to stock it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Soumaré une femme âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et a 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 ans. Avec son prêts elle vend du tissu teinté et des chaussures. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son petit commerce lui permettent de participer pour la nourriture et santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Soumaré is a 29-year-old married woman who has six children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years.  With her loans, she is selling shoes and dyed cloth.  The profits earned from her small business enables her to contribute to her children's nourishment and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SAGITARIO

La Alcancía Comunal Sagitario está conformada por 10 socias responsables que viven en la comunidad de Huachipa en Ate Vitarte. La presidenta Teresa H. se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. Su suegro le regalo a  su hija dos lechoncitos, que luego dio crías y tuvo la idea de  venderlos  así poco a poco comenzó a investigar acerca de la crianza de los cerdos, y le dio mucho resultado, ahora ella puede aportar para los gastos necesarios de su familia  ya que el trabajo es compartido.
La mayoría de las socias se dedican a ese negocio, pero como todo giro tienen desventajas, ellas nos comentan que cuando comenzó la enfermedad de la gripe AH1N1 perdieron mucho, bajo el precio y no pagaban lo que costaba, así que para poder mantenerse tuvieron que venderlos a precios muy bajos que no les cubría ningún costo por el contrario grandes pérdidas, durante ese tiempo buscaron trabajos anexos que le permitían cubrir sus gastos; ahora que se está regularizando la situación pueden continuar con su negocio, ellas saben que con una buena alimentación y manteniendo la higiene constantemente pueden vender  productos de calidad  a sus consumidores.
Las socias solicitan créditos que será destinado a la compra de alimentos balanceados para cerdos ya que en diciembre tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Alcancía Communal Bank The Alcancía Communal Bank is comprised of ten responsable members who live in the Huachipa community in Ate Vitarte. The president, Teresa H., raises and sells pigs. Her father-in-law gave her daughter two piglets, and they later had babies. She had the idea to sell them. Little by little she started to investigate raising pigs. That gave her very good results. Now she can contribute to the necessary family expenses because the work is shared. The majority of the members work in this business. Like all fields, it has its disadvantages. The members tell us that when the AH1N1 flu started, they lost a lot, prices dropped, and they were not paid what the pigs cost them. In order to be able to get by they had to sell them a very low prices that did not cover any of their costs. To the contrary, they had big losses. During this time they looked for other work that would allow them to cover their expenses. Now that the situation is normalizing they can continue with their business. They know that with good feeding and by always maintaining hygiene they are able to sell their quality products to consumers. The members are asking for loans to buy balanced food for the pigs because there is much demand in December.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: María Pilar

texts.es: María Pilar L. reside en Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. María tiene 58 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores de edad quienes se encuentran trabajando. María se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde su casa, tiene diez años de experiencia dedicándose a lo mismo lo que hoy le permite ser muy conocida en la zona y tener una clientela frecuente, María ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente y ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas, ella ahora solicita de este crédito para comprar maíz y leña para la producción de tortillas.
texts.en:
. María Pilar lives in Soyapango in the San Salvador department. She is 58 years old and lives with her husband and her two eldest sons who are adult and employed. María sells tortillas from her home and has 10 years of experience in this line of work which makes her very well-known in her area; she has many regular customers. María has managed loans previously and has been very punctual with her repayments. She asks for this loan to buy corn and firewood needed to make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood for tortilla production.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola es una socia trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 30 años, es madre de dos niños, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y  prendas de vestir,  su esposo es obrero en un aserradero. Paola forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desde hace dos años, tiempo que ha sabido desarrollarse económicamente, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en productos de belleza. Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir y vender a sus diferentes clientes. La meta de Paola es llegar a tener un bazar bien implementado.
texts.en:
Paola is a bank member who works hard and perseveres. She lives in Pucallpa in the Ucayali region and is the 30 year old mother of two children. She sells beauty products and clothing for living and her husband works at a Sawmill. Paola has been a member of the communal bank “Mujeres al Progreso” for two years. During this time she has learned how to develop herself economically. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she invested in beauty products. Today she needs loan for 1000 soles to buy articles of clothing to sell to her various clients. Her goal is to have a well established variety store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 29 anos, casado y tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 18 y 13 años pero solamente uno vive con su familia. El otro es un agricultor en Buenes Aires, un distrito norte de Palmira. William cultiva café pero quisiera empezar produciendo frijoles. El tiene pasto libre pero necesita fertilizantes y manos de oro para prepararlo por frijoles y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de Fudecosur. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo.  Le gusta los prestamos fudecosures por que ha tenido un prestamo con una cooperativa pero ahora la coorperative nunca tiene fondos disponibles.  él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable. Quiere trabajar por sus hijos y ojala que vayan a estudiar en colegio.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old, married, and the father of two children who are his first priority. His children are 18 and 13 but only one of them lives at home. The other is a farmer in Buenos Aires, a district north of Palmira. William is a coffee farmer but would like to start to farm beans. He has available land but needs fertilizers and a green thumb in order to prepare it for planting beans. This is why he is asking for a loan from Fudecosur. It is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he believes this loan will help him make his fields productive. He likes loans with Fudecosur because he had had a loan with another cooperative but now it never seems to have funds available. He hopes to provide his wife and children with a better, more stable, future. He wants to work for his children and hopes that they will pursue higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.en:
Danelia Umana is a 45-year-old mother of 3 children, ages 13, 15, and 18, all of whom are in school. For the last four years, she has made a living selling clothing and shoes around the town of Nagarote, Nicaragua. She walks door-to-door selling her shirts, pants, t-shirts, shoes, and other types of clothing. The longer she does this, the easier it gets, she says, because now she has a client base and enough money to invest a little back into the business. Before she started this business, she was a seamstress. 

Danelia is planning to use her loan to improve the house that she lives in with her husband, children, and father. It is her father’s house and they have lived there for the past 35 years. The loan money will go towards building the walls for a new room to help make life more comfortable for her family. She says that her loans have a very positive impact, because they give her the freedom to do what she wants with her house. Without loans, she would not be able to make any improvements. 

This is her second loan with CEPRODEL, a Kiva field partner that is headquartered in Managua, Nicaragua.

loans.use: To build walls for a new room in her house

loans.name: Claudia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Claudia D. Los Ángeles R. D. A. resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador en el municipio D. Soyapango. Claudia tiene 34 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos William D. 13 años y Antonio D. 6 años, ambos niños estudiantes. Asencio el esposo D. Claudia trabaja como motorista pero las ganancias percibidas son muy bajas y no logra cubrir las necesidades del hogar ; es por ello que su esposa Claudia ha montado un negocio, para estabilizar la situación económica, tiene un negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza y cuidado como cremas, perfumes, maquillas, ropa, zapatos entre otros. Ella solicita D. un crédito para invertir en su bazar surtiéndolo D. nueva mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia D. Los Ángeles lives in the San Salvador department, Soyapango municipality. Claudia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, William, 13 and Antonio, 6. Both children are students. Asencio, her husband, works as a driver but his salary is very low and isn't enough to cover all the household expenses. For this reason, Claudia has started a cosmetics sales business. She sells beauty supplies such as: creams, perfumes, make-up, clothing, shoes, among other items. She is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor 5 Group

texts.en:
Emilia is a 46-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Emilia is the coordinator for her group, El Señor es Mi Pastor #5 (The Lord is My Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Emilia lives in Boca Chica, a small town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. She lives with her husband and four children, and runs a small clothing shop. With her new loan, Emilia plans on purchasing the latest styles of pants and blouses for women and jeans, polos, and t-shirts for the men who shop in her store. 

This is Emilia’s first loan with Esperanza, and she is excited for the opportunities that an increase in capital provides. She hopes to expand her store’s selection, and one day have her own shop rather than renting. With four children, Emilia also hopes to earn enough profits so that she can send them all to university. Thank you for lending to Emilia and El Señor es Mi Pastor group!

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA
La Alcancía Comunal Dios es amor y mi guía  está representada por la Presidenta Sra. Dora y cursan el quinto ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad. Están ubicadas en la zona D. Ate Vitarte.
 La Sra. Dora se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, además D. impulsar la marca también hace demostraciones D. maquillaje, eso le ayudó a la educación D. sus hijos que ahora ya son mayores.
La socia Shirley es la secretaria del grupo,  al igual que la Sra. Dora se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza,  además D. ser promotora en su zona,  incentiva a las socias para desenvolverse en este rubro.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades relacionadas con el comercio tales como: venta D. productos D. belleza, buffet, óptica, venta D. comida, pequeñas  bodegas. Todas tienen mucho entusiasmo para salir adelante. Ellas saben que tienen mucha competencia y es por eso que renuevan constantemente sus productos.
Todas las socias están contentas con los préstamos pero desean aumentar sus ventas,  es por eso que solicitan préstamos  para comprar productos e insumos que les permita obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
The Community Savings, God is Love and my GuiD. is represented by the president, Mrs. Dora and this will be their fifth loan where they have shown to be punctual and responsible with their loans. They are located in the region of Ate Vitarte. Mrs. Dora sells beauty products; besides selling the products she gives makeup demonstrations which have helped her educate her now grown children. The member, Shirley, is the secretary of the group, and like Mrs. Dora she sells beauty products. Besides being a promoter in her region she encourages the members to develop in their lines of work. The members have different businesses like selling beauty products, buffet, optical, food and small mini markets. They all are very enthusiastic to get ahead in life. They know they have a lot of competition and this is why they constantly renovate their products. All the members are happy with the loans but they wish to increase their sales, this is why they need the loans to buy the products and invest so they can get more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Ana Esther

texts.es: Ana Esther P. D. G. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango del departamento D. San Salvador. Ana tiene 49 años D. edad vive con su esposo y tres hijos Josué D. 24 años quien trabaja, Alexander D. 15 años y Jonathan D. 12 años años, ambos estudiantes. Ana tiene cuatro años D. haber iniciado su negocio que empezó solo con unas cuantos perfumes que comercializaba con su vecinos pero ahora ella ya ha comprado una pequeña vitrina donD. tiene exhibidos sus productos, el deseo D. Ana es poder tener un bazar en su casa donD. ofrezca mas variedad D. artículos para sus clientes como camisas, pantalones, zapatos,  entre otros; es por ello que solicita D. un crédito que le permita surtir su inventario
texts.en:
Ana Esther lives in the Soyapango municipality of the San Salvador department. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and her three children: Josué, 24, who works; Alexander, 15 and Jonathan, 12, both of whom are students. Ana started her business 4 years ago and she began with just a few perfumes which she would sell to her neighbors. But now, she has purchased a small display case where she has her products. Ana's wish is to have a bazaar in her home where she can offer her customers a wiD. variety of articles such as shirts, trousers, shoes, among other things. This is the reason she is requesting a loan, to purchase inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: La señora Aura L. Martínez tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, entre lo que sobresale la venta de vestuario, calzado, juguetes, trastes plásticos. La señora ya tiene 5 años de haber empezado con su negocio, ella inicio en coordinación con una hermana, la cual en ese tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada y poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento y vende en noviembre o diciembre, sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea diversificar sus mercancías e introducirse a vender otros tipos de artículos, como electrodomésticos, artículos escolares. el sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, con ello pretende invertirle más a su negocio para que sea más rentable y de allí obtener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura L. M. is 30 years old. She is a single parent to her son of three years of age. She sells general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, toys and plastic containers. Ms. M. began her business over 5 years ago. She started it along with her sister. Back then, her sister sold used clothing. Slowly, she began to increase her inventory, until building up the business she has today. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. If she is able to purchase merchandise now and sell it in November or December, her margins will increase, since prices are currently low. It is also her intention to diversify her line of products and introduce appliances and school supplies, as well. Her dream has always been to do some improvements to her home and, therefore, improve the quality of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santos Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Santos del Carmen tiene 47 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, que ya están casados y con familias independientes. La señora Santos tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Este negocio empezó hace 19 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos, éste dio resultado y desde ese tiempo fue invirtiéndole más y más a su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos para incrementar sus inventarios actuales. Su meta es llegar a tener un supermercado que brinde mejores facilidades económicas a ella y a sus hijos, aunque estos ya tengan hijos y vivan separados.
texts.en:
Santos del Carmen is 47 years old, married, and the mother of three adult children who are already married and forming independent families of their own. Santos has a small grocery store which she operates from her own home. She began this activity about 19 years ago with very little working capital as an attempt to have additional family income. She had positive results and since that time she has been investing more and more into her business. This funding will be used to buy basic grains to add to her current inventory. Her goal is to have a supermarket which will yield better economic results for her and her children, even if they already have children of their own and no longer live at home with her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dianke

texts.fr: Dianké B. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce, elle vend des tissus, des sacs de voyage et valises. Elle soutien son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Dianké B. is a 44-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for six and a half years.  She's developing a small business selling fabrics, travel bags, and suitcases.  She supports her husband in covering family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her commerce

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es mujer trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 57 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, Rita se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y alquiler de motocarro, actividad que comparte con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” desde hace ocho años, Rita recibió un crédito de 300 soles la primera vez, dinero con el cual pudo invertir en ropa para niños.
Actualemente ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar zapatos, billeteras, correas y prendas de vestir que serán comercializados a sus clientes. La meta de Rita es tener un establecimiento propio, para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Rita is a hard working woman with a spirit of perseverance. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 57 years old and the mother of two sons who are now of age. Rita sells clothing articles and is involved in motor-cart rentals. She shares this responsibility with her husband. She has been a member of the Banco Communal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (“Working Women”) for eight years now. The first time, Rita received a loan of 300 soles which she invested in clothing articles for children. At the moment, she needs a loan of 3000 soles which she will use to purchase shoes, wallets, belts and clothing articles which will be sell to her clientele. Rita’s goal is to have her own store from where she could sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, wallets, belts and clothing articles.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia C. de 50 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador. María tiene tres hijos pero todos ya son independientes, ellas vive sola con su esposo.  José el esposo de María trabaja como electricista y también da servicios de transporte, y María trabaja en su puesto que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado la tiendona. El negocio de María tiene  veinticinco años comercializando grandes cantidades de verduras y frutas ya que este mercado vende al por mayor de sus productos, surtiendo a varios vendedores del gran San Salvador, María solicita de un crédito para invertir en su negocio, que muchas veces carece de variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
María Antonia is 50 years old and lives in the San Salvador department. She has three children, all of whom are independent and on their own. She lives with her husband, José, who works as an electrician and also works in transport. María works at her stall which is located in the La Tiendona market. For 25 years María has sold large quantities of vegetables and fruit since this market sells its products at wholesale, supplying various vendors in the greater San Salvador area. María is asking for financing to invest in her business which often lacks a variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her fruit and vegetable stand.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es: Danelia tiene 42 años, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una mujer muy alegre. Su actividad económica es una librería Danelia tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando actualmente el cursa el 4 año de secundaria. Su esposo aportaba ciertos ingresos a su familia, por lo que eran de ayuda para salir adelante, lamentablemente su esposo tuvo un accidente y el estado de salud que enfrenta es que no puede caminar y pasa todos los días en una silla de ruedas, pero esto no le impide a Danelia seguir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de artículos como borrador, cuadernos, reglas y tijeras. El sueño de Danelia es montar su propio negocio, y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Danelia is 42 years old and for the past 7 years has been involved in this business which makes her a very cheerful woman. Se runs a bookstore. She has one son who is a student currently in the 10th grade. Her husband used to contribute some income to the family which helped with expenses but, unfortunately, he suffered an accident which has left him unable to walk and confined to a wheel chair. This does not prevent Danelia from continuing with her business. The financing she is requesting will be used to purchase articles such as erasers, notebooks, rulers and scissors. Danelia's dream is to have her own business and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 4 ans et demi, elle a été 9 fois bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Avec son crédit elle développe un commerce de tissu et de bijoux. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses faliales.
texts.en:
Mariama S. is a 48-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for four and a half years.  She has been the recipient of a loan nine times and has never had a problem repaying.  With her current loan, she's developing a cloth and jewelry business.  The profits earned from her business enables her to participate in meeting family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her commerce

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LEILA,a quien apreciamos en la fotografía sentada) tiene 32 años, tiene dos hijas de 15 y 4 años de edad, es muy activa y trabajadora debido a que tiene que asumir la totalidad de los gastos de su hogar. Ella es integrante de la ALCOM “Grupo Unido” desde hace tres años y medio, junto a nueve personas más, actualmente ocupa el cargo de tesorera del grupo.
La Sra. Leila, se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y accesorios ofreciéndolos  a todos sus conocidos, de puerta en puerta y visitando empresas. Inició este negocio desde muy jovencita ya que a los 15 años tuvo que pensar en cómo mantener a su hija, así que inicio vendiendo gelatina ambulatoriamente y así formar un pequeño capital, el cual fue de 160 soles con lo que compró ropa para ofrecerlo a sus vecinos y amigos, al principio no tenía ganancia debido a su falta de experiencia. 
Con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido adquirir  los artefactos para su casa, sus muebles, dar educación a sus hijitas y ayudar a su madre a cancelar una deuda.
El préstamo solicitado le servirá para pagar la inicial de una moto, la cual le será muy útil para el traslado de su mercadería ya que actualmente debe caminar mucho cargando peso y con un transporte le será más fácil y podrá visitar más clientes.
texts.en:
Leila (who can be seen sitting in the photo) is 32 years old and has two daughters who are 15 and 4 years of age. She is very active and hardworking since she is responsible for all of her home expenses. She has been a member of the ALCOM “Grupo Unido” for three and a half years together with nine other people and currently holds the position of treasurer in the group. Leila works at selling clothing, shoes and accessories, offering them to all the people she knows, going door to door and visiting companies. She began this business as a young woman because already at 15 years old she had to think about how to take care of her daughter, so she started selling gelatin as a vendor. Thus, she earned a little income, which was 160 soles that she used to buy clothes to sell to her neighbors and friends. In the beginning, she was not earning much due to her lack of experience. With hard work and effort, she has been able to acquire items for her house, furniture, give her daughters an education and help her mother pay off her debt. The requested loan will go towards the down payment on a motorscooter, which will be very useful for transporting her merchandise since she currently must walk a great deal bearing the weight. With a means of transport, it will be easier for her and she will be able to visit more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Down payment for a motorscooter

loans.name: Antonia Gladys

texts.es: La señora Antonia F. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive en casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores. Ella es natural del Caserío de Córdova – Huancavelica, actualmente vive en Caserío San Antonio perteneciente al distrito de Santiago – ICA. Es una persona muy trabajadora que ha comprado su propio terreno y brinda educación a sus hijos tratando de mejorar su forma de vida. Se dedica al negocio de venta de abarrotes en general habiendo implementado una pequeña bodega desde hace 1 año aproximadamente. Además se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos teniendo una pequeña granja en su propio domicilio. Empezó con un capital propio producto de la venta de cerdos. Requiere financiamiento para comprar mercadería y aumentar sus ventas en estos meses de Fiestas Navideñas. Su sueño es construir su casa de material  noble y hacer crecer su negocio para bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia F. is 44 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her two youngest children. She is from Caserío de Córdova, Huancavelica. She currently lives in Caserío San Antonio, in the district of Santiago, Ica. She is a very hardworking person who has bought her own land and who is providing an education to her children to improve their lives. She sells groceries and has had a small grocery store for approximately 1 year. She also raises and sells pigs since she has a small farm where she lives. She started her business with her own capital that she got from selling pigs. She needs a loan to buy merchandise and increase her sales during the Christmas holidays. Her dream is to build a house with good materials and to grow her business for the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the Christmas shopping season

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: Kadidiatou Traoré est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et a la charge de ses 3 petits enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 7 ans et y a reçu 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Avec son crédit elle fabrique des jus naturels qu'elle conditionne dans des sachets en plastique et les vend devant les écoles ou dans des milieux où il y a un grand rassemblement. Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou Traoré is a 60-year-old married woman who has her three grand-children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for seven years and has received fourteen loans, which she has always repaid without difficulty.  With her current loan, she's making natural juices that she packages using plastic bags and sells in front of schools or where many people have gathered.  She helps her husband to meet day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small business

loans.name: Jayro Hobel

texts.en: Jayro Hobel S. is 34 years old. He and his wife have a one-year-old child. His wife is an elementary school teacher. Jayro began his business when he opened a small store in his home. After a few years, with the store doing well, Jayro incorporated a taxi business. It was possible for Jayro to buy a vehicle because of the success of his store but also because of a loan. He has been able to manage two loans and his credit history is very good. This loan will go towards the purchase of items for the store; grains, oil, soap, fruits and vegetables, bicycle parts, etc. He dreams that he will continue to be able to increase the amount of products he has to offer his customers.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Elba Ruth

texts.en: Elba Ruth G. L. is not married. Her three children are grown and are independent from their mother. Elba is 62 years old. For 36 years, she has run an eatery. She began her business with the idea of walking from place to place and selling her foods to customers as she found them. With the profits from the early business, Elba was able to establish a permanent location in the central market of Somotillo, near the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. Her biggest customers are the other merchants at the market. Elba often extends credit to them. A good businesswoman, Elba dreams of improving her business with every passing day. She doesn’t rely on the support of anyone and is proud of her independence

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Oulimatou

texts.fr: Oulimatou B. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec son seul enfant. Elle est dans le Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 7 ans et y a reçu 13 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Avec son crédit elle fait du commerce de "Nététou", un produit alimentaire local. Elle achète le produit à l'état brute, le transforme et le vend au niveau des marchés locaux. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et de venir en aide à son enfant.
texts.en:
Oulimatou B. is 60 years old and a widow living with her only child.  She has been with the Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for seven years and has received 13 loans, which she always repaid without difficulty.  With her current loan, she is selling nététou, a local food product.  She buys goods in their raw state and processes them for sale at the local marketplaces.  This business enables her to support herself and to come to her child's aid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es una señora de 31 años, casada hace más de 8 años,  ella y su marido trabajan en  producción de  leche cruda  así como también se dedican a la agricultura cultivando maíz, cebolla, papa y alfa alfa para el consumo de su ganado. Tienen 3 hijos que estudian en una escuela que está a 5 km de la casa donde viven.

La señora Lourdes  no tiene casa propia viven en la casa de su madre, la vivienda no cuenta con todas las comodidades. Tienen  4 cabezas de ganado lechero  con las cuales producen leche para luego entregar a  una empresa que elabora diferentes tipos de productos lácteos.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de ganado lechero, de esta manera incrementara  la producción de leche, lo cual significa  aumentar el nivel de ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y de su familia.

La señora Lourdes y su esposo tienen el sueño de tener su casa propia  y además cerca a la ciudad para que los hijos puedan ir a una escuela más cercana, su meta es ver a los tres hijos profesionales y  hacer   crecer  el número de vacas que tienes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and has been married for 8 years. She and her husband produce raw milk. They are also farmers who grow corn, onions, and potatoes, as well as alfalfa for their cattle. They have 3 children who attend school 5 kilometers from their home.

They have 4 dairy cows with which they produce milk to sell to a company that manufactures a variety of dairy products. This loan will be used to purchase another cow, and in this way increase their production of milk, which will, in turn, increase their income and improve the quality of life of their family.

Lourdes does not have her own house, but lives in her mother's home, which does not have modern conveniences. Lourdes and her husband dream of having their own home close to the city so that their children can attend school closer to home. Their goal is to one day see all three of their children become professionals. They also want to increase the number of cows that they own.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one dairy cow

loans.name: Iris Isabel

texts.es: Iris es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad. Iris se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella vende a crédito sus productos y la cobranza es diario y semanal, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se desempeña como docente en una escuela. Iris forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, desde hace ocho años.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar golosinas y vender en su casa. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir y vender. La meta de Iris es llegar a tener un bazar y seguir aportando en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Iris has been a member of the “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (“Hardworking Women”) Community Bank for eight years and is a dynamic and collaborative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region, is 40 years old, and is the mother of three adult children. Iris has a business selling clothing. She sells her products on credit and collects payments both daily and weekly. Her husband is a school teacher and is supportive of her.

The first loan that Iris received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase sweets to sell from home. She is now requesting a loan for 1000 soles, to buy clothing to sell. Iris's goals are to have her own shop and to continue contributing to her household's income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Marcia M. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de ropa el cuál es atendido por ella misma ofreciendo ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros y niños. 

Actualmente, la señora Marcia solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería como lo es la ropa para continuar en su venta y así brindarle mejor servicio a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Marcia owns her clothing sales business which she operates herself in the department of León. She offers clothing for women, men and children. She is asking for funding to buy more clothing so that she can continue with her sales and offer her customers, who visit her establishment daily, better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Don Ricardo es un señor de 56 años, casado hace 20 años, él y su esposa trabajan en la producción de leche cruda y en sector agricultura produciendo semilla de cebolla , maíz y alfa alfa para el consumo de su ganado.
Don Ricardo tiene su casa propia pero es de una construcción muy simple, no cuenta con todas las comodidades. Tienen  6 hijos de 19, 16, 14, 12, 8, y 3 años  el mayor solo ha terminado  la secundaria, el desea estudiar una carrera pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos por lo  tanto actualmente trabaja  de ayudante en un taller mecánico. Los demás hijos están en la primaria en una escuela que está a 5 km de la casa.
El préstamo será destinado para compra de ganado lechero que incrementara la producción de leche lo cual  significa aumentar el nivel de ingreso y mejorar el nivel de vida de toda la familia. El sueño de don Ricardo es ver a todos sus hijos con una carrera para que ellos puedan tener mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo is a 56 year old man who has been married for 20 years. He and his wife work in the production of raw milk and also grow onion, corn and alfalfa seeds for their dairy cows to eat. Mr. Ricardo owns his own house but it is of very basic construction and doesn’t have all the modern conveniences. He has 6 children ages 19, 16, 14, 12, 8 and 3. The oldest has only finished secondary school; he would like to study a trade but doesn’t currently have the economic resources. In the meantime, he is working as an assistant in a mechanic shop. The other children are in a primary school 5km away from the home. The loan would be intended for the purchase of dairy cows to increase milk production. This will allow for a growth in revenue and an improvement in the standard of living for the whole family. Mr. Ricardo’s dream is to see all his children in a profession so that they may have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of one head of dairy cows

loans.name: Adela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Adela de los Ángeles M. posee su propio negocio de venta de frutas y verduras siendo comercializadas por ella misma en grandes canastos donde coloca los perecederos.

Actualmente la señora Adela ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas y verduras y esencialmente en la compra de las naranjas para continuar ofreciéndolas y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio en desarrollo.
texts.en:
Adela de los Ángeles has her own fruit and vegetable sales business in the department of León. She sells the items herself from large baskets where she places the perishables. Adela is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, in particular oranges, so that she can continue to have them in stock thereby improving the conditions of her developing enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dolores De La Concepción

texts.es:
En una de las calles del departamento de León, la señora Dolores C. se ha destacado por ser una vendedora de frutas y de bebidas ofreciéndolas a sus clientes que a diario visitan el local.

A pesar que el local donde ella se encuentra no presenta las condiciones necesarias para llevar a cabo la actividad, ella busca la manera de cómo mejorar su situación y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito con el que comprará las frutas y las verduras para posteriormente ofrecerlas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
On one of the department of León's streets, Dolores has stood out as a fruit and beverage salesperson offering them to her customers who daily visit her site. Despite the fact that the locale in which she operates does not have the necessary conditions to carry out this activity, she still seems to find the way to better her situation and for this she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy the fruits and vegetables which she will then offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and beverages.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo, la señora María Lourdes L. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de bisuterías y adornos las que son comercializadas en su propia localidad donde muy amablemente ofrece los productos con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las bisuterías y los adornos para continuar ofreciéndolos a sus clientes y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del negocio que poco a poco va en desarrollo.
texts.en:
With great effort María Lourdes tends to her costume jewelry and decorations sales which she graciously conducts from her own home with the purpose of earning income to pay for household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase costume jewelry and decorations so that she can continue to offer them to her customers thereby improving her always developing business' conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry and decorations.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia Manuela; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo , la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años, al engorde de ganado vacuno, y a la venta de pasto, también nuestra socia cría cuyes, aves de corral, chanchos; la socia  también tiene un terreno el cual lo alquila o lo da en anticresis para invertir ese dinero y comprar mas animalitos para la venta, nuestra socia a su vez vende leche de vaca fresca cerca de 15 litros al día o en un par de días, ella lleva a  ofrecer a diferentes lugares donde ella ya tiene sus caseros (personas que la conocen y siempre le compran). Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en la compra de  más animales vacunos o de animales menores.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara para hacer crecer su negocio y así seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the "LAS TRIUNFADORAS" communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district which is 5 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 55 years old, married, and has one son. She alternates her household chores with retail sales. For the past 10 years she has been involved in cattle raising and fodder sales. She also raises guinea pigs, barnyard fowl and pigs. In addition, she owns a parcel of land which she leases out or takes in tenant farmers using the income to buy additional small beasts to raise and sell. Manuela also sells about 15 liters of fresh cow's milk daily or every couple of days. She sells to her regular customers. She requests financing to buy more cattle or small farm animals. She is grateful for the loan that will be granted for it helps her business grow and continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small farm animals.

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.es:
La socia Tiburcia; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es conviviente, su pareja es ganadero y tienen 2 hijos los cuales a la fecha ya son independientes, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño emporio en el cual venden todo tipo de carnes y embutidos, ellos tiene este negocio desde el año 2006, la socia aprovecha que su pareja es ganadero y le trae las carnes frescas para su venta. Nuestra socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de animales vacunos para continuar con el crecimiento de su  negocio.
texts.en:
Tiburcia is a member of the "LAS TRIUNFADORAS" communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district which is 5 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 40 years old and lives with her life partner, who raises cattle. They have two children who are now independent. She alternates her household chores with retail sales. She has a small store in which she sells all kinds of meats and cured meats. They have had this business since 2006. She makes use of her husband's being a cattle rancher for he brings her the fresh meats to sell. She would like to use the financing to buy more cattle so that her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
La señora María Alexandra Párraga S. es socia del Banco Comunal 24 de Septiembre ubicado en la ciudad de Portoviejo en  la provincia de Manabí;  María es  casada y madre de tres niños.

Maria es  comerciante desde hace diez años,   tiene una  despensa  y una farmacia  ubicados en la casa de sus padres; en la despensa podemos encontrar productos de primera necesidad, carnes rojas, pescado, pollo  y  legumbres.

El horario de atención  es de  6 de la mañana  hasta las 10 de la noche de lunes a domingo por lo que le ayuda su hermana,  el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación lo va  invertir en productos como arroz, azúcar, legumbres, carnes y en medicina para abastecer sus negocios y para cubrir algunos pagos pendientes con sus proveedores.

Su sueño es  montar un supermercado para ofrecer un mejor servicio y variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Alexandra Párraga S. is a member to the “24th of September” Community Bank, located in the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. María is married and has three children.

María has been a businesswoman for ten years. She has a grocery store and pharmacy in her parents' home. Among the items sold in her shop are first aid supplies, red meat, fish, chicken, and vegetables. Her shop is open from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm, seven days a week, so her sister helps her run it.

She will invest this loan in products such as rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, and medicine to stock her business. She will also cover some outstanding debts to her suppliers.

María's dream is to start a supermarket to offer better service and a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, and medicine to stock her business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Justina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 71 años de edad, ella es viuda, y tuene 5 hijos, todos sus hijos son actualmente independientes, ella tiene  una cantera de piedras en Rumicolque, desde hace 20 años. Está cantera les permitió vender lajas de piedras pulidas para la decoración de casas y hoteles en la zona, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en el alquiler de camiones para sacar las piedras.

La socia esta muy agradecida con el préstamo que se le otorgara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia Justina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene 71 años de edad, ella es viuda, y tuene 5 hijos, todos sus hijos son actualmente independientes, ella tiene una cantera de piedras en Rumicolque, desde hace 20 años. Está cantera les permitió vender lajas de piedras pulidas para la decoración de casas y hoteles en la zona, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en el La socia esta muy agradecida con el préstamo que se le otorgara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el plazo establecido. Justina is a member of 'LAS TRIUNFADORAS" communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district which is 5 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 71 years old, a widow, and the mother of five independent children. She has had a rock quarry in Rumicolque for the last 20 years. This quarry allowed her to produce and sell polished stone tile used in decoration of area homes and hotels. She needs financing to She is grateful for the financing which will be granted and pledges here to repay her installments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease trucks to remove boulders.

loans.name: Roxana Yenny

texts.es:
La socia Roxana; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, ella es conviviente, su pareja es agricultor, y tiene 2 hijos,  ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la confección de muñecas de trapo y títeres en el distrito de Andahuaylillas. La socia trabaja para terceros, por lo que el dinero que solicita es para comprar cosas personales para sus menores hijos.

Nuestra socia agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This is Roxana. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and 5 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Roxana is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. Her partner works as a farmer. Roxana divides her time between her household chores and making rag dolls and puppets in the district of Andahuaylillas. She works for a third-party broker, so the money she is requesting will be used to buy personal items for her children.

Roxana appreciates the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use (purchase items for her children)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  señora Rosa P. Macías  es socia activa del Banco Comunal 24 de Septiembre en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí, ella tiene  siente años de casada y  dos niños aun pequeños.

Rosa  junto a su esposo tienen  una panadería en el cantón Tosagua, por algunos años trabajaron  en Portoviejo pero  hace un año decidieron regresarse a Tosagua porque ya tienen su fiel clientela,  el  esposo de nuestra socia es el encargado de administrar y repartir el pan en bicicleta a las tiendas de su comunidad mientras que Rosa se dedica a la elaboración del producto.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación  van a comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración del pan como  mantequilla, harina, latones para hornear,  huevos, etc.  Así como para incrementar otras variedades de pan de sal y de dulce y para mejorar la producción que tienen a la fecha de  300 panes al día y llegar a mas clientes. 

El sueño de  Rosa es poder montar un mini-market  con todo lo necesario en productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar,fideos, granos, artículos de limpieza y aseo personal para su distinguida clientela en la ciudad de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
Rosa P. Macías is an active member of the “24th of September” Community Bank in the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. She has been married for seven years and has two young children.

Rosa and her husband have a bakery in Tosagua county. For several years they worked in Portoviejo, but last year decided to return to Tosagua because they already had a loyal clientele there. Rosa's husband is in charge of the administration of the business and delivers the bread by bicycle to shops in their community. Rosa is responsible for making their products.

They will use the funds from this loan to purchase bread-making supplies, including butter, flour, eggs, baking pans, etc. In that way, they will be able to produce other varieties of sweet and savory breads to increase their output (which is currently 300 loaves of bread daily) and serve more customers.

Rosa's dream is to have a mini-market selling all household necessities, including first aid supplies, rice, sugar, pasta, grains, cleaning products, and personal hygiene items, for her distinguished clientele in Portoviejo.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread-making supplies, including butter, flour, eggs, and baking pans

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia Luisa; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; Ubicados en el distrito de Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad, ella conviviente con su pareja y el es cocinero, ellos tienen 3 hijos ellos aún no se casan por que esto genera gasto y no están en condiciones de hacerlo, por que tienen otras gatos importantes que no pueden esperar, nuestra socia  cría animales menores (cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral). Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar más animalitos y hacerlos reproducir, para su futura venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Luisa. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and 5 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Luisa is 39 years old and in a common law marriage. Her partner works as a cook and they have 3 children who are still single because they are not able to handle the expenses associated with married life. In addition, they have other expenditures that they have to deal with at the moment.

Luisa raises small animals such as guinea pigs, piglets, and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals for breeding and future resale. Luisa appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Fortunata; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; ubicados en el distrito de Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
