Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada pero su esposo trabaja lejos y es como si estuvieran separados, según nos manifiesta la socia; tiene 4 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el el empleo de obrera, ella trabaja en el teatrin para terceras personas, nuestra socia embaza alcachofas, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde el año 2002. nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

Ella agradece y valora el préstamo del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Fortunata. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and 5 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Fortunata is 33 years old and married. Her husband works away from home and she tells us, “It is as if we are separated.” Fortunata has 4 children and divides her time between her household chores and her job as a contract laborer at a packing station where she packages artichokes. She has been doing this type of work since 2002.

Fortunata is requesting a loan for personal use. She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her, and agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia Gabriela; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad, casada su pareja confecciona ropa, y tienen 2 hijos los cuales ya son independientes,  ella se dedica al comercio minorista,  vende comida en el mercado desde el año 2004. la socia cocina muy delicioso y tiene mucha clientela que adora su comida, ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mayores insumos y continuar con sus negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Gabriela. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and 5 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Gabriela is 43 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. Her husband manufactures clothing. She is dedicated to her small business selling food in the market. Gabriela has been in operation since 2004. Her dishes are delicious and she has many customers who love her food. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients in large quantities so that she can keep her business running.

Gabriela appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly D. is from the village of Danlugan Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old. Pearly is married. To make a living, Pearly owns & operates a sari-sari"  general store, selling a variety of products such as can goods, sugar, rice, salt, shampoo, soap and other products needed in the local community. Pearly has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Pearly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pearly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pearly is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Pearly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to save the income for a future emergency. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Maria; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; ubicados en el distrito D. Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años D. edad, y tiene 2 hijos mayores, ella almacena maíz y trabaja en la municipalidad D. Andahuaylillas como administradora desD. el año 2008, nuestra socia también tiene terrenos, los cuales los cultiva con maíz, papa y otros productos, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un nuevo terreno.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y D. este modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. las cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” communal bank, located 5 minutes from the city of Cuzco in the district of Andahuaylillas.

Maria is 55 years old and has 2 older children. She stores corn and she has worked in the municipality of Andahuaylillas as an administrator since 2008. Maria also has lands, which she uses to cultivate corn, potatoes, and other products. She is asking for this loan to purchase new land.

Maria is thankful for and values the loan provided to her, and she promises to make her loan repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small plot of land for cultivation

loans.name: Francacio

texts.en:
Francacio G. is from the town of Tuburan, Aloran Mis. Occ. He is 55 years old. Francacio is single. To make a living, Francacio owns & operates a store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Francacio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities. The income from his business is used for his daily needs.

In 2007, Francacio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Francacio is requesting a new loan of 7000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Francacio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Claudia Fidencia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Fidencia M. tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la elaboración de alimentos y venta de abarrotes. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que ella y su esposa el señor Ramón J. son los que atiende el negocio.
Les está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía pero en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder invertir y no quieren descapitalizar el negocio, es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así su negocio tendrá más inventario.
Planean pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que se obtiene del negocio ya que los gastos familiares serán de su trabaja con promotora de ventas en un súper mercado.
texts.en:
Claudia Fidencia M. has been involved in food production and grocery sales for more than a year now. This business is the source of income for her family, and both she and her husband, Ramón J., are the ones that attend to the business.

They are lacking variety of merchandise but they currently do not have the necessary funds to invest in the purchase of new items and they do not want to decapitalize the business. It is for this reason that they are asking for a loan so that their business will have greater inventory.

They plan to repay the loan with the income obtained from the business since the household expenses will come from their work with sales promotion in a supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the town of Panalsalan, Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Julieta is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. She sells seafood products like fish, shrimp, etc., in the market of the community of Panalsalan. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in and expand the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to meet the daily basic needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in and expand the business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is from the village of Calube, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Josephine is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and other basic needs in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. owns a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of products. She is 23 years old and single, from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Janet is just starting her business.

In 2009, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 pesos from GDMPC. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her community. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 02.1.8 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Vinh Lê Thị is a 46-year-old female living in the town of T. Hoá. Vinh is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn.

Vinh is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Vinh makes and sells food. The main source of income for her business comes from selling rice products in the local community. Vinh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1500000 Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vinh joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vinh is requesting a loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is requesting a new loan of 3000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Vinh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Lê Thị Phúc is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2. Lê Thị T. Giang is an 18-year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

================================

Vinh Lê Thị (47) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoá.  Vinh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn.


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Vinh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Vinh kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND.  Vào 2009, Vinh đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Vinh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Phúc (48) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Lê Thị T. Giang (49) là 18 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Ruby is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hường  T. Thị is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hường is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn.

Hường  is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Hường runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community.  Hường has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hường  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hường  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Tố is a 64-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

2.  Ngô Thị Tự is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of operating a specialized retail store.

3.  N. Thị H. Nguyên is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

4.  B. Thị H. Tươi is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

5.  Ngô Thị Hương is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

6.  Ngô thị Thanh is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

7.  Đỗ Thị Phương is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Anecito T., 36, is from the city of Bitoon Ozamiz City.  He is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecito owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en:
Hiên Thị Vũ is 60 years old. She is a farmer and breeds pigs. She lives in Xuan canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi and has four children who are married. Her husband is a security guard for a hotel in Ha Noi.

Hiên Thị Vũ has obtained loans from micro-fund organizations for three years and has always repaid on time. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. Her family life is difficult, so she wants to access the loan to develop her business and enjoy a better life. So she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (approx. 350 USD) to invest in her pig-breeding business.

Hiên Thị Vũ is the group leader of a six-member group loan from SEDA. The five other fund participants are:

Hòa Thị Hoàng is 34 years old and is a hard-worker. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approx. 235 USD) to invest in pig-breeding.

Mai Thị Năng is 33 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approx. 285 USD) to start a small business.

Mai Thị Đào is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approx. 235 USD) to buy food for her pigs.

Liên Thị Lê is 45 years old. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approx. 235 USD) to invest in pig-breeding.

Lý Thị Đào is 33 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approx. 285 USD) to start a small business.

Clarita says that having a husband abroad is difficult, but they need to sacrifice to support the educational needs of their children.

Mrs. C. wants to help her husband send their children to school, because she knows that meeting the needs of their children in school is costly. She learned that through this program she could help her husband, so she wants to borrow 40,000 pesos to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Nary Clavelita

texts.es:
La Sra. Nary Clavelita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y es madre, de una pequeña niña, que aun depende de ella. 

Recientemente, viene dedicándose a la Venta  de Repuestos de Motos, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes. Se inicio con el primer préstamo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le ha brindado.  Posteriormente, continúo superándose y hoy en la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, ya más implementado y poco a poco ha ido ganado clientes y haciéndose mas conocida.
Con este préstamo de S/.700.00, comprara cadenas de motos, pistones, arrastres, rodajes, empaquetaduras y ponchos.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Nary Clavelita dice: Que a su edad, el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Nary Clavelita belongs to the community bank “La Paz II” in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín. She is twenty years old and has a live-in partner. She is the mother of a little girl who depends on her. Recently she has been selling parts for motorbikes. Her business is located in her home, in a space well-equipped to attend her customers. She began the business with a loan Movimiento Manuela Ramos provided her. Subsequently, she continued bettering herself, and, to this days, works in the same business. Now her business is more established and little by little she has gained more customers and made herself more well-known. She will use this loan of 700 soles to buy bike chains, pistons, gears, gaskets, and other parts. She is an independent woman who administers and makes the decisions for her business. Nary Clavelita says: at her age, being part of a group of woman has helped her learn her rights better and together ensure that these rights are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bike parts

loans.name: Mir Malang

texts.en: The man who is pictured is Mir Malang, the son of M. A.. He lives in the 19th district of Kabul Afghanistan. He would like to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to construct his house. He needs to buy construction materials with his loan. He is glad that these kinds of processes exist in Afghanistan to support the people.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Llaque Reyna

texts.es:
La Sra. LLaque, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre, de 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella. 

Su espíritu luchador y las ganas de salir adelante y aportar con los ingresos económicos en su hogar, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos, que se encuentra ubicada, a las afueras de  su casa, un ambiente muy acondicionado , para atender a sus clientes, que día a día acuden a su puesto a comprar. LLaque comienza a vender sus asaditos a partir de las 5:30 pm y dice estar muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, y poco a poco ha ido ganado clientes y haciéndose mas conocida.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos como: arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio. Agradece infinitamente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por haber cumplidos sus sueños y metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Sra. Llanque is a member of the Communal Bank “La Paz II” which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children.

Due to her fighting spirit and desire to succeed, Llanque has been able to generate a household income. She started a business selling anticuchos outside of her home, which is suited for receiving customers who come by every day wanting to buy something to eat. Llanque begins selling her grilled meats at 5:30pm and says she is happy with the work she has accomplished. Her business still continues to this day and she gradually gains more customers and becomes better known.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, Creole chickens for making “juanes” (traditional Peruvian dish of cassava, rice, and meat steamed in a banana leaf), butchered chickens for making “anticuchos”, and cooking utensils so that she can provide high quality service.

Today Llanque is an independent woman who manages and makes the decisions for her business. She is infinitely grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies
