Bernadette s’approvisionne au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo et également à Cotonou. Bernadette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui sollicite un autre crédit auprès de l’institution en vue de diversifier son activité et de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
B. Bernadette is born in 1964 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Bernadette has been living in the Zounkpa neighborhood in Porto-Novo for about twenty years. She is a widow who has two children, all in school, at her care. She takes care of the family expenses alone. Bernadette stopped classes in primary school. It's been eight years Bernadette has been making and selling "akassa" at her home. She also sells onions. She gets her supplies at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and also in Cotonou. Bernadette is an old customer of ALIDe who is requesting another loan from the institution to diversify her business and to better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, charcoal and baskets of onions

loans.name: G.s. Los Angeles Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario compuesto por dos personas, tiene 3 créditos y es uno de los grupos que han sido responsables con su pago. Doña Iveth de los Ángeles  vende ropa y productos zermat como perfumes, cosméticos de manera ambulante y en la universidad donde ella estudia, realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son de contado y al crédito con la cual ha apoyado el sustento familiar, goza de buena reputación entre su vecindario La  señora Loyda yesel,  su actividad es la de comercializar  ropa y perfumes de manera ambulante y sus comarcas, realiza sus compras  en Managua de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado. Vive con su familia.
texts.en:
This close knit group made up of two persons has three loans and is one of the groups that has been very good in their repayments. Mrs. Iveth de los Angeles sells clothing and Zermat products such as perfumes and cosmetics as a street vendor and also at the university where she goes to school. She buys in cash and sells in cash or on credit. This activity has helped her with the support of her family and she has developed a good reputation among her neighbors. Mrs. Loyda Yesel sells clothing and perfumes as a street vendor in her region. She purchases her products in Managua, paying cash, and sells on credit or in cash. She lives with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est constitué de huit femmes (4 veuves et 4 mariées)  vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 61 ans,  4 enfants  et habitant  le quartier Djaka (Kirango) de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali : Ségou). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, de voisinage et font presque la même activité génératrice de revenus qui tourne autour du poisson sous toutes ses formes. 
Ce groupe est également organisé en  coopérative de transformatrices de poissons initiée par l’ANPE (Agence Nationale pour L’Emploi). Elles ont reçu des formations portant sur les différentes méthodes de transformation et de conservation dans les mesures d’hygiène retenues par le  BIT (Bureau International du Travail). Elles ont bénéficié de  deux fours modernes et des séchoirs.
Après  4 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, ce groupe est à son 5ème  prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 80 paniers de poisson et 100 barres de glace. Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger, elles les trient d’abord, une bonne partie de ce poisson est séchée. Le poisson frais se vend sur place, à Ségou ville (marché château), à Bamako,  Koutiala et Sikasso. Le poisson séché est surtout vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango et à Ségou et une partie est conservée jusqu’à la décrue où elles gagnent plus d’argent.  Le poisson fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant  et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui servira à augmenter le volume de leurs activités, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux (habillements, savon, pétrole) et à participer aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage, circoncision et décès). 
Elles ont pour ambition une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouman group is made up of eight women (4 are widows and 4 are married). They live in large traditional families and they average 61 years of age and 4 children. They live in the Djaka (Kirango) district of Markala (the 4th administrative region of Mali: Segou). They know each other through family, marriage, and through neighbours. They carry out the same business to generate revenues, all surrounding fish and in all forms.

The group was organized through a fish processing cooperative started out by Anpe (National Employment Angecy). They have all received training on various hygiene techniques provided by BIT (International Work Bureau). They are have two modern ovens and dryers to their disposal.

After having successfully repaid 4 past loans, the group is requesting their 5th loan which is to be used to purchase 80 baskets of fish and 100 blocks of ice. They purchase fresh fish along the Niger River, sort them, and keep a good portion of them to be dried. The fresh fish is sold at Segou (in the Chateau market), Bamako, Koutiala, and Sikasso. The dried fish is mostly sold in Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango and Segou, though they keep a portion to sell in the fall when they can earn more money. Smoked fish is mostly sold in Segou. Sales are generally completed in cash and credit to a clientele made up of men and women.

They hope in producing a monthly revenue of 80 FCFA which will help increase the volume of their sales, and to satisfy the needs of their family (including clothing, soaps, and petroleum). They will also be able to participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, circumcisions, and funerals).

They dream of buying a residential home for themselves.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en: Reyna Isabel is 45 years old and the mother of two teenagers. Her children, 16 and 18, are both in school. She sells cooked beans and firewood. She started her business two years ago when her partner retired from his work and they needed a way to support themselves. Her good credit history and relationship with Fundacion Leon 2000 made her a strong candidate for a Kiva loan. She reports that her loans have greatly helped support her business and household.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata Sidi M.  est âgée  de 39 ans et  vit avec son mari et ses  5  enfants  et d’autres ménages dans sa belle famille dans le quartier Hamdallaye A de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir abandonné l’école en classe de 7ème (système éducatif Malien) elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des poissons séchés et  fumés au marché de Gao. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière et ayant bien maîtriser les rouages du petit commerce, elle décide d’évoluer en solo en optant pour le commerce de poissons séchés. Elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant  7 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété au niveau de Ségou. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette institution depuis plus 1 an. Après  un 1er prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle est à son  2ème qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 80 kg de poissons séchés (Wulu Djèkè c'est-à-dire Poisson Chien). Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes. Madame Fatoumata Sidi M. vend  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et de participer à des événements sociaux (mariage, baptême etc.). 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Sidi Maiga is 39 years old and lives with her husband, their 5 children and members of her family in-laws. They live in the Hamdallaya district in the city of Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After leaving school in 7th grade (Mali’s educational system) she started her business alongside her mother, selling dried and smoked fish in the Gao market. After many years of learning from her Mom and once she master the workings of a small business, she decided to go on her own selling dried fish. She has been managing her business for 7 years and she enjoys a good reputation and large client base in Segou.

In efforts to her clients’ demands and to increase her revenues, she approached Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). She has been in business with this organization for more than a year now. Following her first loan, which was successfully repaid, she is requesting a second loan in order to purchase 80 kg of dried fish (Wulu Djeke – meaning Dog Fish). She buys from wholesalers. Mrs. Fatoumata Sidi Maiga completes her sales on credit to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She hopes to generate a monthly income of 30 000 FCFA. This income will permit her to contribute with her husband towards the family’s expenses and to participate to social events (such as weddings, baptisms etc.).

Her dream is to build a residential home in Segou.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dried fish.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos mayores, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es viuda desde hace mucho tiempo, pero siempre ha sabido salir adelante con su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ”Mujeres Valientes” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en productos para la venta de menús.  Actualmente Pilar necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que le permitirá invertir una parte en arroz, aceite, azúcar, para la preparación de platos (comida) para vender y otra parte invertirá en la compra de madera para construir cuartos con el fin de alquilarlos. La meta de Pilar es terminar de construir los cuartos para poder alquilarlos y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and the mother of three adult children and runs a small business selling food from her home. She has been widowed for a long time but through her hard work and dedication to her business, she has always managed to come out ahead. She has been a part of the communal bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) for the past eight years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN (~$100 US), which she invested in items to add to her menu. Now Pilar needs a loan of 1,500 PEN ($525 US). She will use part of the money to buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar, which she will use to prepare food to sell to her customers. She will use the rest of the money to buy lumber in order to build small rooms that she can rent out. Pilar’s goal is to rent out the rooms in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food items and lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock manioc flour and tapioca

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is 39 years old.  He is married and a father of two children. The client has been running this mechanical shop for eight years. He has two employees working for him.  He applied for this loan in order to buy additional equipment and hire more labor. The client has a good reputation in the market and has lots of customers.

loans.use: buy equipment and hire additional labor

loans.name: Santos Yonorbi

texts.es:
La señora SANTOS YONORBI C. C., tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella   presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, refiere que dejo de estudiar porque empezó a trabajar como empleada en casas.
SANTOS  es casada, tiene 2  hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la fabricación y venta ambulatoria de calzado en compañía de su esposo.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar materiales como: hilos, cuero, plantillas, pegamento, etc. para la fabricación del calzado que posteriormente venderá. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y así obtener dinero para criar y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Yonorbi C. C. is 35 years old, lives in the Trujillo district of the Trujillo province, La Libertad department in Peru. The associate belongs to the Community Bank "Esfuerzo de Mujeres II"( Effort of Women). She has completed through the 3rd year of secondary school, she discontinued her studies because she went to work as domestic worker. Santos is married and has two small children who depend on her for their support. The member together with her husband makes a living making shoes and selling them as street vendor. This is the first loan request. She is requesting 300 New Soles for the purchase of materials such as thread, leather. soles. adhesives, etc. for the production of shoes that will later be sold. She dreams of increasing her sales and this way earning money to be able to raise and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material for making shoes, such as thread, leather, soles, glue, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is 27 years old, married and has one child. In the last ten years in addition to having a government job he has been running a bakery.  This is the client’s second loan from this microfinance institution. The client spent his first loan on remodeling and upgrading his bakery. He made all his payments on time. He will use this loan to purchase a clay oven and flour.  In the near future the client is planning on hiring a worker to help around the bakery.

loans.use: purchasing clay oven and flour

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa  región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza  por catálogo y también realiza servicio de manicure, limpieza  facial; su esposo siempre la apoya en las diferentes actividades que  realiza. Forma parte del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace siete años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en cremas faciales, en la actualidad  Clara necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza ya que su negocio esta creciendo. La meta de Clara es tener un local y vender todo tipo de artículos para el hogar y tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Clara is a dynamic and hardworking member, and lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old, and she works in the sale of beauty products by catalog, and also provides beauty services such as manicures and facials. Her husband always supports her in the different activities to which she dedicates herself. She has been part of the "Brave Women" Community Bank for seven years, and her first loan was for 300 Soles which enabled her to invest in facial creams. Clara needs a loan for $425 which will be used to buy beauty products because her business is growing. Clara's goal is to have a store and sell different products for the home and have a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sewing machines and work materials

loans.name: Gloria Reyna

texts.es: Gloria Reyna es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive n la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 36 años D. edad, es madre D. dos menores, se dedica a  la confección D. prendas D. vestir y también venD. ropa D. segundo uso, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo en todo momento. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desD. hace dos años, donD. siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en sus pagos. El primer crédito que obtuvo le permitió invertir en productos D. belleza para vender D. casa en casa, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir en telas, hilos, elásticos para confeccionar blusas y luego venderlas. La meta D. Gloria es llegar a tener un taller bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Gloria a a dynamic, cooperative, 36-year-old, woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of two minor children and she makes clothing and sells used clothing. She can count on her husband's support for her activities at all times. She has been a member of the "Loreto" communal bank for the last 2 years and she has always been noted for the timeliness of her repayments. The first loan she received allowed her to invest in beauty products which she sold from home. Currently, she needs a 2000 sol loan to buy fabric, thread and elastics which she will use to sew blouses for sale. Gloria's goal is to have a well-supplies workshop and to continue improving economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and elastic for blouse manufacture.

loans.name: La Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres han sido la base de la sociedad nicaragüense donde el 52% de la población lo conforman estas.  El grupo la oportunidad está integrado por tres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. 

Wendy G. Vílchez hace dos años empezó vendiendo tacos, enchiladas y tajadas con queso al pasar el tiempo invirtió en carne y formo una fritanga. La fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Silvia Elena C. Molina que desde hace 29 años comenzó con un molino manual y actualmente tiene un molino de carne y uno mecánico  y  María E. C. quien vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Women have formed the base of Nicaraguan society, as they make up 52% of the population. The group “La Oportunidad” (Opportunity) is working on behalf of three hard working and enterprising women. Two years ago Wendy began selling tacos, enchiladas and fried plantains with cheese. After some time she invested in some meat and started a home-based take out restaurant. These types of take outs, which sell fried foods and grilled meats to go, are very popular in Nicaragua. The other entrepreneurs are Silvia Elena who began working with a manual meat grinder 29 years ago and now has one manual and one mechanical grinder and Maria who also sells clothes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, meat, plantains, and other vegetables

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is a 46-year-old woman. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She lives together with her family in a rented apartment. She is a food vendor and sells banku and kenkey. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked in the form of balls and taken with hot pepper sauce or soup. She sells her kenkey (fermented corn dumpling eaten with stew or soup) in the mornings. 

Afua has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as favorite for breakfast, lunch and supper. With good customer care, she has a big market for her kenkey business. She is expecting to increase her profit margin when she receives the loan. She wants to use the loan to buy ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood in bulk. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Lolita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. desde el 2004 vende la fruta que este en cosecha como  elotes, sandias, jocotes, mango, coyolito, grocesea. Ella está casada y tienes tres hijos  menores de edad de 14 años, 9 años y 6 meses respectivamente. Los mayores luego de sus clases le ayudan a atender el negocio. 

U. tiene 4 años de estar con Adim en este tiempo ella se asentido bien con la forma de trabajo y desea continuar en este proceso ya que le ayudado a crecer.
texts.en:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. has been selling seasonal fruit since 2004, items such as sweetcorn, watermelon, jocotes (plum-like fruit), mangoes, coyolito and grocea. She is married and has three minor children, 14 years, 9 years and 6 months of age. The older ones help her with her business after they finish school. U. has been with ADIM for four years in which time she has integrated well with the way it functions and wishes to continue the process since it has helped her grow.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a 50-year-old woman. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She is a baker and a food vendor. She sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as lunch and supper. She also bakes bread to supply to grocery shops around her vicinity. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood, flour, baking powder, sugar, margarine, etc. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en la carretera de Torna, en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad y es madre de siete hijos, todos mayores de edad. Melita se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene parcelas (areas de cultivo) de yuca, frutas y arroz, actividad que lo realiza con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles lo invirtió en la elaboración de carbón para luego venderlo.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de madera para elaborar carbón y vender en el mercado de la localidad. La meta de Melita es tener una bodega bien surtida de productos.
texts.en:
Melita has been a dynamic, hardworking member of the “Mi Señor de los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. She lives in the Señor de los Milagros hamlet which is located off the Torna highway in the Campo Verde region of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and the mother of 7 children, all of whom are adults. Melita is a farmer and she has parcels of land where she cultivates yucca, fruits and rice together with her husband. Her first 300 sol loan was used in the making of charcoal for sale. Currently she is requesting 1000 soles to buy firewood which will be used to make charcoal for sale at the local market. Melita's goal is to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood to turn into charcoal.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 33 years old and married with a child. Patricia lives together with her family in an old family house. She loves fashion very much and as a result, trades in jewelry like earrings, necklaces and other fashionable accessories. She has been selling jewelry for the last four years. Patricia buys her goods from Accra. She hawks with her goods from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell. 

Patricia wants to use the loan to buy jewelry in bulk so she can trek to other markets. She believes in her ability to make more profit to support her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 55 years old and married with 5 children. Currently only two of her children are in school; the rest have completed school and are working.

Adwoa has been trading in palm oil and palm kernel oil for the past 25 years. She She treks to towns and villages to purchase palm oil and palm kernel oil from the producers in bulk to sell at retail to her customers. She hopes this loan will enable her inject more capital into her business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil and palm kernel oil to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

Adwoa is a member of a group called Love Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is fifty-two years old. She is married with two children who are currently schooling.

Matilda is a food vendor who sells fufu. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, cooked and pounded together and taken with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of the Ghanaian society. It is enjoyed either as lunch or supper.

Matilda wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Vilma De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Vilma de los Ángeles F. L. desde que era niña conoce el trajín de tener una pulpería ya que esta perteneció a sus padres que luego se la heredaron. Ella invertirá el crédito en comprar granos básicos y otros productos de uso en el hogar como jabones, champú, crema, carne, pastas de diente y de lustrar, especies y verduras.

El deseo de F. es convertir la pulpería en una miscelánea y con la ayuda de los préstamos y el apoyo familiar que tiene pronto lo lograra.
texts.en:
Vilma de los Ángeles F. L. has known the hectic lifestyle of owning a grocery store since she was a girl, since she inherited the grocery that her parents ran. She will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains and other products for the home, such as soap, shampoo, creams, meat, toothpaste, polish, spices and vegetables. F.' wish is to convert the grocery into a miscellaneous goods store and with the help of the loans and the support of her family that she has, soon she will achieve this wish.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is fifty years old. She is married with 4 children.

Yaa is a food vendor who sells waakye. Waakye is cooked with rice and beans, and enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying, and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more rice, vegetable oil, macaroni, and beans to increase her stock of goods. She believes the loan will help her increase her working capital to make more profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is fifty-four years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children.

Charity is a food vendor who sells gari, beans and fried plantain, which is popularly known as ‘red red.’ It is one of the popular local meals enjoyed by many Ghanaians, especially students, because of its affordability. It is very tasty and satisfying, and very nutritious too because of the protein content from the beans.

Charity wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of gari, beans, bunches of plantains, and palm oil to increase her production and make a good income to support her children's education. She will be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Alberto G. le está haciendo falta un portón al frente de su casa, ya que van tres veces que se han metido a su vivienda a robarle por falta de seguridad ya que trabaja todo el día.
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar el portón y colocarlo.
Don José Alberto es empleado de una compañía en el departamento de atención a los clientes, este es el ingreso que el obtiene y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José Alberto's dwelling lacks a front gate and thieves have broken into it three times already thanks to the lack of security and the fact that he is away at work all day. For this reason he is asking for financing to pay the person who will make and install the gate. José Alberto is employed by a company in the customer service department. He intends to use his salary from this job to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a front gate on his home.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years. He is single.

For the past 5 years, Samuel has been trading in palm oil and palm kernel oil, and sometimes oranges when they are in season. He purchases palm oil and palm kernel oil from the producers in bulk and sells it at retail to his customers. He says due to inadequate working capital, he can no longer buy large enough quantities. He hopes this loan will enable him to inject more capital into his business to meet the demands of the market.

Samuel wants to use this loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil and palm kernel oil to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. He hopes to increase his savings to support his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and palm kernel in bulk

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is fifty years old. She is a widow and mother of seven children. She has been the sole bread winner of the family ever since she lost her husband. She sells smoked fish and tomatoes in one of the neighborhood markets. Many homes enjoy her fish because it has a great flavor and the price is fair. She wants to use her loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fishes in bulk.

loans.name: Luis Santiago

texts.es: Luis Santiago tiene 34 años es un hombre muy trabajador y le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 18 años que con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su propio negocio, y además aportar ciertas ganancias para su familia, Luis tiene 3 hijos y necesitaban estudios, ropa y alimentación como un padre responsable tenía que buscar los ingresos necesarios con mucho empeño y dedicación logro mantener este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de electrodomésticos, calzado, ropa interior y pantalones. El deseo de Luis es brindarle a su familia los servicios necesarios.
texts.en:
Luis Santiago is a 34-year-old, hard-working, man who enjoys his work very much. He has sold general merchandise for the last 18 years and through his efforts has managed to own his own business and provide certain earning for his family. Luis has 3 children who needed clothing, food, and education. As a responsible parent he knew he needed to earn the necessary income to provide for them and his dedication and effort allowed for him to have this business. The funding he is requesting will be working capital with which he will buy electrical appliances, footwear, underwear and pants. He hopes to provide his family with the necessary services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose A. A. A. tiene la edad de 50 años, es padre casado y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 25, 24, 22, 19 y 14 anos, repectivamente, y todos viven en la casa. El quiere comprar una ganado para leche. Hace muchos años que se dedica al campo y quiere crecer. Ahora no tiene ganada, solomente cultiva cafe en su finca propia pero tiene pasto libre que le gustaría usar por vaccas. Es su primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido credito con otros bancos en el pasado. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable.
texts.en:
Jose A. is 50 years old, married, and the father of 5 children who are his first priority. They are 25, 24, 22, 19 and 14 years old, respectively and they all live at home. He wants to buy dairy cattle. For many years he has been a farmer and wants to expand. He currently doesn't have any cattle, he only farms coffee on his own farmland but, he has unused land that he would like to to use for cows. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he has not had any previous credits with banks. He hopes to provide his wife and children a better and more stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 45 years old. She is married and has four kids, all of whom are currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop where she sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods, drinks, and assorted cooking oil. She wants to use this loan to buy stock of rice, canned foods, drinks, and milk; essentially, to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she will have increased capacity to provide a pleasant accommodation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian, 34, a married mother of two boys and a girl who are currently in school,  enjoys selling and is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop that sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed milk powder, etc. However, she is constrained by low capital and therefore is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar,  vegetable oil,  body and hair creams, etc. in order to increase her stock of goods available.  The additional ensuing income, Vivian believes, will enable her to actualize her dreams. 
,

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, a responsible 40-year-old married mother of five children, has her children's needs and welfare at heart. Currently, two children have completed school and are working while her other three are still in school. Comfort is a trader selling used clothes, popular with many people, and thus she has many customers. However, due to only a small amount of working capital, she can barely sell enough to make a reasonable profit; therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more bales of used clothes in order to increase her income to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 45 years old. She is a wife and the mother of 4 children. Ama is resourceful mother and successful business woman. She works hard to be able to send her children to school.  Currently, her business is trading secondhand clothes and bedspreads in her neighborhood. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth.  She believes that, with the loan she will be able to purchase more bales of second hand clothes and bed spreads. She hopes to save enough income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Perla Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo Perla son originarios de la comarca Pilas Orientales zona rural de Masaya donde su principal actividad es la agricultura. 

Denis de Jesús G. desde que era niño aprendió el arte de la agricultura. El cultiva maíz, frijoles, pipián y ayote en una pequeña parcela donde en los tiempos libres le ayudan sus hijos los cuales estudian. 

G. trabaja con Adim a partir del 2001 y ha continuado porque le gusta la forma de trabajo y la ayuda que le brinda. El utilizará el préstamo para adquirir abono, urea, veneno y semillas.

Lucrecia Siles V. de 62 años desde que ella recuerda ha trabajado la tierra y actualmente con la ayuda de su hijo siembra frijoles, maíz, yuca y pipián. Ella trabaja porque es una forma de sentirse útil y para mejorar su vida.

La otra integrante del grupo es Idelia G. ella comenzó asociada con una amiga pero ahora se independizo y cultiva frijoles, maíz, yuca y trigo.
texts.en:
The members of the Perla group are from the Pilas Orientales area, a rural part of Masaya, where their main activity is farming. Denis de Jesús learned farming since he was a child. He farms corn, beans, pipián (a kind of squash or gourd common in Nicaraguan cuisine), and ayote (a squash) on a small plot of land where his children help him on their free time. He has worked with Admin since 2001 and continues because he likes the way they work and the help they offer. He will use the funds to buy fertilizer, urea, insecticide and seed. Lucrecia is 62 years old and she has worked the land for as long as she remembers. With her son's help, she farms beans, corn, yucca and pipián. She works because it is a way to feel useful and to improve her life. The other member of the group is Idelia. She first became associated with a friend but now is independent and she farms beans, corn, yucca and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para abono, urea y semillas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is thirty years old and the mother to 4 children. All her children are in school now. Edi has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. She says business is doing well but she lacks the funds to purchase groceries in bulk. Being able to purchase in bulk is very advantageous because it helps to avoid price hikes and frequent travels to fill the demand. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her children.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María L. está solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de su casa de material, ya que le actual es de madera y no está en muy buenas condiciones. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que necesita para empezar la construcción.
Doña Rosa María es madre soltera y tiene una hija y una nieta bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quiere dar una mejor vida y seguridad.
Ella se dedica a vender desayunos y productos naturales en su casa, este es el ingreso con el cual pagara el crédito, ya que su hija Elva Rosario Hebreo L. se encargara de los gastos de la familia con su ingreso que obtiene de su emplea como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Rosa María is requesting a loan to start brick and mortar construction of her home since her current dwelling is made of wood and not in very good condition. At present she does not have the funds necessary to buy the materials she needs to begin work. Rosa María is a single mother and has a daughter and granddaughter under her care and responsibility and wishes to provide them with a better life and security. She works from her home selling breakfasts and natural products. This is the source of income with which she intends to repay the loan since her daughter, Elva Rosario's, salary from her job as a security guard is what is used to pay for the family's basic daily expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay the foundations for home construction.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is twenty-six years old. She is single. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past five years. Linda is very skillful and a talented hairdresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. She wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to avoid shortages and poor service. She hopes to raise a good income to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase assorted pomades and hair creams in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Help with his livestock

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en:
Zinabu is 35 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits (cookies), etc., in the local market in her community.

Zinabu wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods, drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc., to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide support in taking care of her children’s school needs.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is forty-three years old. She is married and has five kids in school.

Veronica has been trading in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc in the market in her community for two years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the successful traders in the market. She considers this loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables, and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She hopes to increase her profits to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to expand her selection

loans.name: Amistad Y Lucha Group

texts.es:
La Sra. ESTHER  CANDELARIA L. A.,  (la apreciamos en la fotografía sentada, acompañada de las socias del grupo y familiares) Ella  tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, 4 totalmente independientes y el menor que es la razón de su esfuerzo y trabajo ya que lo  apoya económicamente  en el logro de su profesión. Ella integra el Grupo   “AMISTAD Y LUCHA”    junto con nueve personas igualmente trabajadoras residentes del Distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Esther, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios a domicilio, nos comenta que desde muy niña le llamaba la atención las ventas, y en cuanto pudo juntar un poco de dinero empezó vendiendo accesorios de vestir a sus amigas y poco a poco fue formando un capital el cual invirtió luego en la compra de ropa.
Ella se siente satisfecha, porque con su negocio desde muy joven pudo apoyar a sus padres, adquirió sus artefactos, apoyó a su esposo en el pago de los estudios de sus hijos, y así lograr que tengan una profesión.
Hoy en día su trabajo está destinado a apoyar al menor de sus hijos que estudia en la universidad, y cuando puede viaja a provincia donde también ofrece su mercadería  aprovecha la oportunidad para conocer  un poco más su país.
texts.en:
ESTHER CANDELARIA, (who we see in the photo seated surrounded by the members of the group and family members), has 5 adult children, 4 of whom are completely independent. The youngest is the reason for her efforts and work since she supports him economically in his efforts to become a professional. She, along with 9 other equally hard-working persons from the Comas district, make up the “AMISTAD Y LUCHA” (FRIENDSHIP & STRUGGLE) group. Esther sells clothing and accessories door-to-door and tells us that since childhood she has always been attracted to sales. When she was able to gather a little money she began selling clothing accessories to her girlfriends and little by little began to amass a bit of capital which she then invested in the purchase of clothing. She feels satisfied because, with her business, from a very early age, she was able to help support her parents, buy her items, and help her husband with the expense of educating their children thereby insuring that they would have a profession. Today, her work's purpose is to support her youngest child who is a university student and, when she travels to the countryside where she also sells her merchandise, she takes advantage of the opportunity to get to know a bit more of her country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan B. E. G. tiene 42 años, divorciado y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tiene 19 y 12 años y viven con su madre en New Jersey pero el todavía apoyales. El esta empezando un comercio nuevo y necesita cosas para vender. El esta pensando a comprar productos de uso domestico en San Jose y despues, vendelos en Fila Naranja. Es el primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su negocio con este prestamo. El ha tendido crédito con Banco Costa Rica en el pasado pero prefiere los prestamos de FUDECOSUR porque son menos tramites. él desea brindar a hijos un futuro mejor y estable y tambien que sus hijos regresarían a Costa Rica. Ojala que tenga exito con este negocio nuevo.
texts.en:
Juan B. E. G. is 42 years old, divorced, and has 2 children who are his highest priority. His children are ages 19 and 12 and live with their mother in New Jersey, but he still supports them. Juan started a new business and needs items to sell. He is thinking about buying household products in San Jose and selling them in his hometown of Fila Naranja.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he believes his business can grow with the help of this loan. He had taken a loan with Banco Costa Rica in the past but he prefers the loans with FUDECOSUR because less paperwork is involved. He wants to provide his children with a better and more stable future, and he also hopes that they will be able to return to Costa Rica. Juan hopes that his new business will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his new store

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Coumba N. vend de la glace, de la crème glace et du produit détergent depuis trois ans a Camberene, une banlieue situé à quelques kilométrés au nord de Dakar.  Ce crédit représente son premier prêt d'U-IMCEC.  Elle envisage une augmentation de 20.000 frs par mois  de ses bénéfices.  Elle est marie et habite avec son mari et ses trois enfants.  

Madame N. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba N. has been selling ice, ice cream, and detergents for three years in Camberene, a suburb located a few kilometers north of Dakar. This loan represents her first U-IMCEC loan. She envisions an increase of 20,000 francs a month in her profits. She is married and lives with her husband and her three children. Ms. N. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the PDEF (program for child and family development) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children born of destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Fandaw

texts.fr:
Madame Fandaw H. est une vendeuse de petit déjeuner et des poissons.  Elle travail à Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar proche de la mer.  Le petit déjeuner typiquement Sénégalais est constitué de pain avec du chocolat, thon ou Niebe (haricots préparés) avec un café Touba au lait.  Madame Fandaw a plus de 20 ans de expérience dans son activité.  Ce crédit présente son premier prêt. Madame H. est mariée avec cinq enfants.  

Madame H. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fandaw H. sells breakfast meals and fish. She works in Camberene, a seaside suburb of Dakar. The typical Senegalese breakfast consists of bread with chocolate, tuna or Niebe (prepared beans) and a Touba coffee with milk. Mrs. H. has over 20 years experience in this business, but this is her first loan. She is married with five children.
Mrs. H. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Child and Family Development Program (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially aims to protect children born into poor families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these children can receive loans with more flexible terms than ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received funding ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her little breakfast stand

loans.name: Ndatte

texts.fr:
Madame Ndatte G. commercialise des habits et chaussures d'enfants depuis 2004.  Elle est marie avec un enfant et elle habite a Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar.  Avec son crédit, elle envisage une augmentation de 20.000 frs de son revenu mensuel. 

Madame G. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndatte G. has sold clothing and children’s shoes since 2004. She is married with one child and lives in Camberene, a suburb of Dakar. With this loan, she anticipates a monthly revenue increase of 20,000 francs.
Mrs. G. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Child and Family Development Program (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially aims to protect children born into poor families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these children can receive loans with more flexible terms than ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received funding ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her selection of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplies to secure their home (bricks/cement).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more DVDs for her shop

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 5 Group

texts.en:
Juan is the group coordinator of Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) El Buen Futuro (A Good Future). His story is representative of the others in his group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Juan lives in a community called Casa Colorada in the Hato Mayor province of the Dominican Republic. His community is located in a rural area and has poor access to running water and electricity.

Juan sells fruit and has successfully repaid three previous loans. He came to Esperanza for a loan so that he could purchase more fruit and thus grow his business. He plans to purchase 20,000 passion fruits and 35,000 oranges to sell in his community and the surrounding communities.

Juan has used some of the proceeds from his business to purchase shoes and uniforms for his children so that they can attend school. He hopes to be able to continue to improve the living conditions for his family with this loan. Specifically, he would like purchase a fan for his house. Juan's dream is to continue to grow his business so that he can provide for his family, and he thanks you for your support in helping him achieve his goals!

loans.use: To buy fruit (oranges and passion fruit) to sell

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Santos Javier G. le está haciendo falta la barda lateral, ya que la casa que está enseguida de la de él está abandonada y hay muchos animales y gente mala, teme por la seguridad de su familia cuando él no esté en su casa.
Es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y realizar la barda lo más pronto posible. Planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de camión. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Cynthia Aurora Barba ya que el señor Santos Javier se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Javier G.'s house is missing the side wall because the house next to his is abandoned, and there are a lot of animals and wicked people. He is afraid for his family's safety when he is not home. Because of this, he is seeking this loan – because right now he does not have the necessary money to buy the material to build wall as soon as possible. He plans to repay the loan with the funds he gets from his work as a bus driver. The person in the picture is his wife, Mrs. Cynthia Aurora Barba, because Mr. Santos Javier was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Side wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To protect her house and improve security at her business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 58 años, madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, ella tiene una bodega en su casa, actividad que realiza durante el día y por las noches se dedica a la venta de comidas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es electricista. Fredy forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de gaseosas.  Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado, una parte en artículos para su bodega (arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas) y otra parte invertirá en madera para ampliar su negocio (infraestructura) y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fredy is a dynamic and hard-working client, who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and the mother of four grown-up children. She has a general store in her house that she runs during the day and during the night she sells food. She receives help from her husband who is an electrician. Fredy has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Solteritas” for two years, and her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to purchase soda. Now, she needs a 1200 sole loan, which will be used in part for items for her general store (rice, sugar, pasta, and soda) and in part for wood to enlarge her business (infrastructure) to provide her clients better service.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy items for her general store and wood to enlarge her business

loans.name: Dina Ines

texts.es:
La señora DINA INES C. D. C., tiene 64 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo , departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6To D. primaria ya que desD. pequeña ella se tuvo que dedicara al campo.
Ella vivió hasta los 13 años en Otuzco y sus padres se preocuparon mas por enseñarle los que haceres del campo, el cuidado D. los animales y los que haceres domésticos que por darle educación.
La socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores, quienes la apoyan y la cuidan cuando se enferma.
DINA se dedica a la compra y venta D. vino al por mayor que trae D. la cuidad D. Casca y los venD. para eventos especiales como: Matrimonios, Bautizos, Aniversarios, Cumpleaños, Promociones, etc.
También venD. botellas D. vino al por mayor y menor en su domicilio.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. galones  D. vino al por mayor para luego distribuirlo en Trujillo.
EL crédito D. 1,500 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra D. mas galones D. vino y botellas para envasar.
La empresaria sueña con aumentar sus ventas, comprar andamios y poder exhibir los vinos en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dina Ines C. D. C. is 64 years old, lives in the Trujillo district in the province of Trujillo in the Libertad department of Peru. She belongs to the Mujeres al Progreso Communal Bank. Dina only studied through 6th graD., because ever since she was young, she has had to work on a farm. Until she was 13 years old, she lived in Otuzco, and her parents spent more time teaching her the chores of the farm, like caring for the animals and domestic chores, than they did on her education. She is married with five grown-up children who help her and take care of her when she gets sick. Dina makes her living by buying bottles of alcohol wholesale and selling them retail in her home. She spent her first loan of 300 soles on gallons of wholesale alcohol for distribution in Trujillo. This new loan, of 1,500 soles, will go towards the purchase of more gallons of alcohol and bottles. She dreams of increasing her sales and buying scaffolding so she can sell her alcohol out of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale liquor.  Purchase of bottles for bottling liquor.

loans.name: Litoral De Senkata Group

texts.es:
En el centro Focal “Senkata” hace 10 años aproximadamente se reúne la asociación  “Litoral De Senkata” formado por doce integrantes, trabajan con la ilusión de mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares. 
Diversos son los  negocios de este grupo,  por ejemplo, Norberto se dedica a la electrónica hace diez años, Angélica realiza trabajos en macramé, Remedios confecciona deportivos y camisetas,  Tomas junto a su esposa son carpinteros, Esta asociación necesita  capital para la compra de mercadería o materia prima (repuestos, hilos, telas, madera y otros dependiendo el caso)
texts.en:
From the Senkata community center, the “Litoral De Senkata” Association started approximately 10 years ago. The group is composed of twelve members who work together in hopes of improving their families’ financial conditions.

Several different businesses are represented within this group. For example, Norberto has been selling electronics for ten years. Angélica produces macramé handicrafts. Remedios sells sportswear and jerseys. Tomas and his wife are carpenters. The group is need of capital so that they can buy merchandise or supplies (spare parts, thread, fabric, wood, and other items depending on the business).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise & supplies

loans.name: Romulo Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Rómulo Álvarez tiene 62 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el Distrito de Ocucaje junto a su esposa y su menor hija. Anteriormente vivían en Lima junto a sus 4 hijos pero su esposa tuvo un accidente automovilístico en la cual murió uno de sus hijos y su esposa quedó gravemente enferma. Gracias a su actividad de carpintero pudo progresar nuevamente con su familia trasladándose a la  ciudad de Ica. Es una persona muy trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo a comprado herramientas para realizar sus labores de carpintero. Actualmente su esposa lo ayuda vendiendo golosinas recorriendo las zonas cercanas al distrito. Con sus ingresos están brindando educación superior a su menor hija la cual aún está a su cargo. Solicita financiamiento para realizar construcción de tanque de agua ya que este ultimo año se han tenido muchos problemas con el servicio de agua potable,ademas de compra de madera para realizar cerco de su taller poniendo a recaudo sus equipos y herramientas. Sus sueños son lograr que su hija sea una profesional y hacer crecer su taller de carpintería. El Sr. Álvarez agradece el apoyo que podamos brindarle para hacer crecer su negocio y por ende su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Rómulo Álvarez is 62 years old and lives in a home he owns in the Ocucaje district, with his wife and his youngest daughter. Previously he lived in Lima with his 4 children, but his wife was involved in an automobile accident, which killed one of his sons and rendered his wife gravely ill. Thanks to his work as a carpenter he was able to forge ahead and move his family to the city of Ica. He is a hardworking person, and with great effort has purchased the tools necessary for his work. Currently his wife helps him by selling snacks in the areas surrounding his neighborhood. With their income they are providing their daughter, who is dependent on them, with a better education. He is requesting a loan to install a water tank in his home, as this year they’ve had problems with their drinking water service, as well as to purchase lumber so he can build a fence around his carpentry shop and keep his tools and equipment secure. His dream is for his daughter to become a professional and for his carpentry shop to grow. Mr. Álvarez is grateful for the support we can provide him so his business can prosper, thus improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora  ROSA MARIA R. E., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II . Ella   presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria,  es  casada tiene 3  hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de alimentos, tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos alimenticios como: leche, gaseosa, cerveza, verduras, etc.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles comprará gaseosas, verduras, leche, arroz ,fideo, golosinas, etc para surtir su bodega. Rosa sueña con ampliar su negocio y así poder obtener más ganancias para los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
ROSA MARIA is 38 years old, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú and is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II communal bank. She finished 11th grade, is married and has 3 small children who depend upon her financially. She buys and sell foodstuffs and has a small grocery store which she runs from her own home. With her first 300 sol loan she bought food items like: milk, soft drinks, beer, vegetables. etc. With this new 500 sol loan she will buy soft drinks, vegetables, milk, rice, pasta, snacks, etc. to stock her store. Rosa dreams with enlarging her store so that she can make better profits to pay for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, vegetables, milk, rice, pasta, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Products for his store and fertilizer for his coffee.

loans.name: Idita

texts.es: Idita es una socia dinámica y trabajadora que siempre lucha por sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de dos niños, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también a la venta de pescado (trucha)y queso que le envía su mamá de la ciudad de Huancayo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la construcción de lanchas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal "Rumbo al Éxito" desde hace un año. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en queso, ahora necesita un crédito  de 1200 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza como cremas, talcos, perfumes. La meta de Idita es tener una tienda de abarrotes  y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Idita is a dynamic, hard-working, woman who always fights for her ideals. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She's 31 years old and the mother of two children. She sells beauty supplies and she also sells fish (trout) and cheese that her mother sends her from the city of Huancayo. Her husband, who is a boat builder, supports her endeavors. She's been a member of the "Rumbo al Éxito" (Road to Success) communal bank for the past year. Her first 300 sol loan was used to invest in purchasing cheese; now she needs a 1200 sol loan which will be used to buy beauty supplies like creams, talcs, perfumes. Idita's goal is to have a grocery store and to continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty supplies like creams, talcs and perfumes.

loans.name: Carmela Constanzia

texts.es:
La señora CARMELA CONSTANZIA J. A., tiene 70 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS. Ella  es analfabeta, refiere que desde pequeña empezó a trabajar en el campo. CARMELA tiene 5 hijos todos mayores; pero a su cargo tiene 3 nietos que se quedaron huérfanos a quienes apoya otorgándoles sus alimentos y estudios porque su madre falleció y su padre actualmente tiene otro compromiso y no se hace cargo de ellos. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta  de leche . Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró leche y cantifloras (embase) para vender la leche en su pueblo.

Con este crédito de 300 nuevos soles también volverá a comprar leche al por mayor para seguir vendiendo y así obtener dinero para seguir apoyando a sus nietos.
La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
CARMELA CONSTANZIA is 70 years old and lives in the district of Trujillo, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SAN LUIS communal bank. She is illiterate and states that she has worked the land since she was a little girl. She has 5 adult children but she is responsible for the wellbeing of 3 grandchildren who were orphaned when their mother died and it is Carmela who must see to their food and education because their father is involved elsewhere and does not take care of his children. She buys and resells milk. With her first 300 sol loan she bought milk and containers in which to sell it in town. With this 300 sol loan she will buy milk again at wholesale to continue selling it and obtain profits with which to continue to support her grandchildren. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can pay for her grandchildren's education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk at wholesale.

loans.name: La Mojarra Group

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR CARLOS T. M. NACIO Y VIVIO EN PALMA CUATA DURANTE 43 AÑOS. POSTERIORMENTE SE CASO Y SE FUE A VIVIR A POTRERO NUEVO, LA CUAL ES UNA COMUNIDAD DEL MUNICIPIO DE IGNACIO DE LA LLAVE.

DON CARLOS SIEMPRE SE HA DEDICADO A LA PESCA, LA CUAL ES UNA ACTIVIDAD MUY COMUN EN LA REGION YA QUE  EXISTEN VARIAS LAGUNAS Y UN RIO  ALREDEDOR DE SU COMUNIDAD. EN SUS INICIOS COMENZO COMO CHOFER PERO DEBIDO A UN ACCIDENTE CAMBIO DE TRABAJO Y OPTO POR CRIAR VACAS. ALTERNA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD COMENZO CON LA PESCA LA CUAL LE HA DADO MUY BUENO RESULTADOS YA QUE LOS VENDE EN SU COMUNIDAD. EL COMPRA TODO TIPO DE MARISCOS COMO LO SON MOJARRA, TILAPIA, CHUCUMITE, CAMARON, PULPO, JAIBA, CARACOL, OSTION, ETC.


LA META DE DON CARLOS ES PODER HACER UN LOCAL EN SU PATIO PARA SU VENTA. POR LO CUAL EL SOLICITA UN CRÉDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MARISCOS Y POSTERIORMENTE HACER UN TECHO Y PISO PARA TENER SU MERCANCIA MAS PRESENTABLE YA QUE ACTUALMENTE LO HACE  SOBRE UNA TABLA EN EL PATIO DE SU CASA AL AIRE LIBRE.


ES EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO LLAMADO  LA MOJARRA   FORMADO POR 4 SEÑORAS Y EL, SUS COMPAÑERAS SE DEDICAN ENTRE OTRAS ACTIVIDADES A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS Y   PERFUME POR CATALOGO Y   BOLSAS DE MANO.
texts.en:
Carlos was born and lived in Palma Cuata for 43 years. Later, he got married and moved to live in Potrero Nuevo which is a community in the municipality of Ignacio de la Llave. He has always been a fisherman, which is a very common occupation in the region since there are several lakes and a river in his community. At the beginning he started working as a driver but, due to an accident, he had to change jobs and started raising cows. Alternating with this activity he fished which has yielded very good results since he sells his fish among his community. He buys all kinds of seafood such as mojarra (a small, broad fish), tilapia, chucumite (fat snook), shrimp, octopus, crab, snail, oyster, etc. Carlos's goal it to build a stand in his yard from which to sell his wares and he is requesting a loan to buy the seafood and then to build a floor and roof so that his merchandise will be more presentable than currently possible with a board in the open air in his yard. He is the group representative of the group called LA MOJARRA which is made up of 4 ladies and himself. The ladies are involved in other activvities such as the sale of shoes, purses, and catalogue perfume sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stall from which to sell fish.

loans.name: Liliams Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora LILIAMS EVELYN Z. A., tiene 20 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS 5 ESTRELLAS . Ella  Es soltera y presenta estudios superiores de enfermería técnica, pero nunca ejerció porque cada que le ofrecían trabajo era poco el pago, por ese motivo decidió crear su propio negocio empezando a vender productos naturales. 
La socia se dedica a la compra y venta  de  productos naturales que los vende por catalogó y también con producto en mano (stock). Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró ropa para   caballeros, damas y niños para vender a sus familiares y amistades.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará productos naturales que se encuentran en oferta para abastecer su stock y también comprará otros productos que le han pedido.
La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así cubrir sus propios gastos.
texts.en:
LILIAMS EVELYN lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad, department, Perú. She is 20 years old and a member of the LAS 5 ESTRELLAS (5 STARS) communal bank. She is single and has finished training as a technical nurse but has never practiced her profession because each job she was offered was very poorly paid. Because of this, she decided to create her own business starting with the sales of natural products. She buys and sells natural products both that she stocks and has on hand and via catalogue. With her first 300 sol loan she bought clothing for gentlemen, ladies and children which she sold among her friends and family. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy natural products which are on sale to add to her stock and will also buy other products for which she already has orders pending. She hopes to increase her profits so that they will be enough to cover her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora PAULA Z. P., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS. Ella  es analfabeta, no presenta estudios porque refiere que sus padres no se preocuparon por enviarla a la escuela; sino porque aprenda las labores del campo y por ese motivo desde pequeña empezó a trabajar en el campo. PAULA tiene 8 hijos de los cuales, los 2 últimos dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos que compra los días viernes y los vende los días martes en Otuzco o pueblos aledaños, paralelamente se dedica  a la venta de harinas y granos como: mote,maíz, menestras, etc. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró quesos y quesillos al por mayor para luego viajar a venderlos en Otuzcos o pueblos aledaños. Con este crédito de 800 nuevos soles comprará queso, quesillos, menestras , mote y maíz al por mayor para luego viajar a venderlos. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener mayores ganancias y continuar apoyándo a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paula Z. P. is 58 years old and lives in the Trujillo district, province of Trujillo. department La Libertad in Peru. This member belongs to the Community Bank San Luis. She is illiterate, has not had any formal education because she states that her parents did not send her to school, wanting her to learn to work on the farm, which she started doing from a very young age. Paula has 8 children of which the two youngest ones still financially depend on her since they are both studying. She makes a living buying and selling cheeses, which she buys on Fridays and sells on Tuesdays in Otuzco or other neighboring towns. She also sells flour and grains such as maize, corn, legumes, etc. She used her first loan of 300 New Soles to buy cheeses and fresh cheeses at wholesale which she later sold in Otuzco and other towns. She will use this loan of 800 New Soles to purchase aged and fresh cheeses, legumes corn and corn meal at wholesale which she will later travel to sell. The associate dreams of increasing her sales and this way making more money and being able to continue to support her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheeses, legumes, corn for resale

loans.name: Silvia Group

texts.es:
Liliam del Socorro B. F., Marvin José B. L. y Zoila María F. conforman el grupo Silvia. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Liliam B. quien comenzó hace tres años vendiendo meneítos, luego introdujo gaseosas, helados y fresco. Actualmente con el préstamo lo invertirá en granos básicos y aceite para así ir surtiendo la venta. 

Marvin B. tiene seis años de vender verduras y  Zoila F. distribuye  prendas de oro y plata en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
The Silvia group is made up of the following members: Liliam del Socorro, Marvin José and Zoila María. Liliam is the group leader. She began three years ago selling meneítos (a puffed-cheese snack), then introduced soft drinks and frozen treats. Currently she will use the loan to buy basic grains and oil to stock her sales. Marvin has been selling vegetables for the past six years and Zoila distributes gold and silver items in Costa Rica.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora FLOR DE MARIA R. P., tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II . Ella presenta estudios superiores de corte y confección,  es  soltera y trabaja para apoyar a su madre. La socia se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró 2 celulares y un teléfono fijo inalámbrico y aperturo su locutorio, negocio que mantiene.
Con este crédito de 800 nuevos soles comprará telas, hilos, cierres, etc para confeccionar los pedidos de prendas de vestir que tiene por entregar.
Flor sueña con que su locutorio poco a poco siga captando mas clientes y continuar confeccionando la ropa que le solicitan los clientes para así poder obtener dinero para cubrir sus gastos y poder apoyar a su madre.
texts.en:
Flor de María R. P., 24, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Esfuerzo de Mujeres II Communal Bank. She has a post high school education in tailoring. She is single, and she works to support her mother. She makes articles of clothing for children, youths, and adults. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought two cell phones and one cordless phone. She opened her phone café, a business she maintains. With this loan for 800 PEN she will buy fabrics, needles, and scissors, etc. to make the clothing orders that she needs to deliver. Flor dreams that her phone cafe will, little by little, gain more customers; and that she will continue making clothes that the customers ask for. That way she will be able to get money to cover her expenses and be able to support her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics, threads, and zippers, etc.

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo Amor son de Pilas Occidentales zona rural de Masaya propicia para el cultivo y las artesanías. Ixida Raquel L. C., Virginia Elene L. C. y Nubia G. V. fabrican hamacas.

 Las hamacas son unas de las artesanías y artes que sobre sale en Masaya. Este es un producto de gran demanda que se  fabrica a base de  manila (hilo retorcido), madera y objetos de aluminio o  con fibras vegetales como la cabuya y la pita. 

Ixida L. C. de 24 años aprendió este arte de sus padres quienes fabricaban hamacas y ella junto a sus hermanos y sobrinos han continuado con la tradición. 

Virginia L. C. de 66 años desde muy joven trabaja en la producción de hamacas y desde hace 30 años ella tiene su propio taller en el que le ayudan sus hijos y nietos a los que está orgullosa de transmitir este bello arte. 

Nubia Gradas V. de 27 años desde hace 8 años que trabaja por cuenta propia en la realización de hamacas. Ellas tienen cuatro años de trabajar con Adim con el cual se han ido ayudando y se sienten a gusto con su forma de operar.
texts.en:
The members of Amor group are from Pilas Occidentales, a rural area of Masaya, which is very prone to farming and handicrafts. Ixida Raquel, Virginia Elene, and Nubia make hammocks which are one of Masaya's outstanding handicrafts. It is a product that is in high demand and it is made from manila (netted cord), wood, aluminum objects or with vegetable-based fibers like cabuya and pita (agave-based cord). Ixida, 24, learned this craft from her parents who were hammock makers and she, together with her siblings and nieces and nephews, has continued this family tradition. Virginia, 66, has made hammocks since she was a young girl and for the last 30 years has had her own workshop where her children and grandchildren help her and she happily transmits this beautiful art form to them.
