Nubia, 27, has worked on her own making hammocks for the past 8 years. They have been working with Adim for the past 4 years which has been a help and they are comfortable with the way it operates.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manila (a type of netted cord), wood, aluminum, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora MARGARITA R. B. , tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 6to de Primaria. Se casó a la edad de 17 años y tiene 4 hijos todos menores y se encuentran estudiando por lo cual dependen económicamente de ella. MARGARITA se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, gaseosas, jugos, cerveza, menestras, golosinas, etc, su negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró aceite, arroz, azúcar, fideos, papas al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 300  nuevos soles comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de galletas, jugos, gaseosas, etc. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener dinero y poder otorgarle a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Señora MARGARITA R. B. is 35 years old, and lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo province in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "San Luis," and has completed 6 years of primary education. She was married at the age of 17 and has 4 minor children who are in school and depend on her economically. Margarita is engaged in the business of selling food products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, soft drinks, juices, beer, dried beans, candy, etc.; her business is located in her house. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought cooking oil, rice, sugar, noodles and potatoes wholesale. With this loan of 300 nuevos soles she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of crackers, juices, soft drinks, etc. She dreams of increasing her sales in order to be able to make more money and to provide her children with an education and a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy bags of rice, sugar, boxes of crackers, juices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reymundo R. de 63 años se dedica desde hace treinta años a la crianza y destace de cerdo. Esta es una actividad común en la familia nicaragüense y una alternativa económica para ayudar a generar ingresos a la familia.

El tiene dieses años de estar trabajando con Adim en los cuales se ha sentido muy satisfechos por los logros que ha obtenido por la forma de operar de la micro financiera.
texts.en:
Raymundo is 63 years old and has raised pigs for the past 30 years. This is a common activity in Nicaraguan families and an alternative source of income for the family. He has worked with Adim for 16 years and has been very satisfied both with his accomplishments and with the way in which the micro financing company operates.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Los Gutiérrez Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo los G. son del valle de la laguna que se encuentra localizado  a las orillas de la laguna de Apoyo. La principal actividad de la zona es la pesca.

José Antonio L. L. de 31 años tiene un taxi desde hace cuatro años en el cual invertirá el préstamo y su meta es lograr comprar otro taxi. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana Maritza G. R. quien vende frutas, pan y pinolillo en Granada y Elsa del Carmen G. R., ella vende frutas en Granada.
texts.en:
The Los G. group members are all from Valle de la Laguna which is located on the shores of Lake Apoyo. The main activity in the area is fishing. José Antonio, 31, has had a taxi for the past 4 years in which he will invest the loan. He hopes someday to be able to buy another taxi. The other members of the group are Juana Maritza, who sells fruits, bread and pinolillo (a drink made from toasted corn and a little cocoa) in Granada and Elsa is a fruit vendor in Granada.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gasoline and replacement parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Maximina Florisa

texts.es: La señora MAXIMINA FLORISA H. D. F., tiene 67 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 1ero D. primaria, refiere que sus padres la enviaron a la escuela para que aprenda a escribir su nombre, leer un poco y aprender a firmar porque ellos consideraban que sólo eso era necesario, para que luego empiecen a trabajar. Por ese motivo ella empezó a trabajar desD. pequeña tanto en el campo como en casa. La socia tiene 2 hijas ya mayores quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella. Maximina se dedica a la venta D. menús, cervezas, gaseosas, quesos, quesillos, manjar blanco (dulce D. leche) en el restaurante D. su casa. Con su  primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro sacos D. arroz, sacos D. papa, gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, queso ,manjar blanco y quesillo para que venda en el restaurante que tiene instalado en su casa . Con el crédito D. 3,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos D. arroz, sacos D. papa, gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, queso ,manjar blanco y quesillo. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener mayores ganancias y así hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximina Florisa H. D. F., 67, lives in the Trujillos district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the San Luis Communal Bank. She has a first graD. education. Her parents sent her to school to learn how to write her name, read a little, and to learn how to sign her name because they believed that was all that was necessary to later start working. She started working in the fields and at home when she was little. She has two grown daughters who are not economically dependent upon her. Maximina sells prepared dishes, beer, soft drinks, cheese, “quesillos” (local cheese), and “manjar blanco” (a sweet caramel maD. from condensed milk, similar to dulce D. leche) in the restaurant in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, soft drinks, wholesale beer, cheese, “manjar blanco”, and “quesillos” to sell in the restaurant that she has installed in her house. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, soft drinks, wholesale beer, cheese, “manjar blanco”, and “quesillos” . She dreams of increasing her sales to be able to get greater income to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, soft drinks, wholesale beer, cheese, “manjar blanco”, and “quesillos” .

loans.name: Berta Lina

texts.es: Berta B., es soltera, tiene 48 años D. edad, es originaria D. suchitepequez, tiene 5  hijos, ella tiene una tienda y venta D. tortillas, hace 10 años, su negocio esta situado en su domicilio , ella solicita un crédito D. Q6,000.00. para poder invertir mas en su tienda y tortillería y asi generar mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Berta is single, 48 years old, and from Suchitepequez. She has 5 children and has run a home-based general store and tortilla shop for the past 10 years. She is asking for a 6000 quetzal loan to invest in her store and tortilla shop to generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tortilla shop and general store.

loans.name: Margarita  Dorliza

texts.es: La señora MARGARITA  DORLIZA J. P., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS. Ella  presenta estudios hasta 6to de primara  porque refiere que sus padres no se preocuparon por enviarla a la escuela y después de dejar la escuela empezó a trabajar en casas como empleada domestica. Margarita tiene 4 hijos, todos pequeños quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta leña , que compra al por mayor, le entregan por pedidos cada 15 días y ahora se encuentra a la espera de otro pedido. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro leña al por mayor para vender en su pueblo.  Con este crédito de 300 nuevos soles también volverá a comprar más leña. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así tener diento para la crianza de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita Dorliza Jesús P., 58, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the San Luis Communal Bank. She has a sixth grade education because her parents did not care about sending her to school. After she left school she started working in houses as a domestic employee. Margarita has four small children who are economically dependent upon her. She buys and sells wood. She buys it wholesale and delivers her orders every 15 days. She is now waiting for another order. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought wood wholesale to sell in her town. With this loan for 300 PEN she will also buy more wood. She dreams of increasing her sales in order to have money to raise her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años, es madre de un niño, ella  se dedica a la venta de menús (alimento) durante el día y por las noches vende salchipapas (comida al paso), este negocio funciona en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es cubicador de madera (operario). Esther forma parte del Banco Comunal “Ricardo Palma” desde hace cuatro años. El primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de escobas para vender.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 2700 soles, que invertirá en la compra de un carrito salchipapero (comida rápida) e insumos para la venta de menús. 
La meta de Esther es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Esther is a woman who perseveres. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 24, and she has one son. She sells prepared food during the day. In the evenings she sells “salchipapas” (fast food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes). This business is in her house. She has her husband’s support. He is a carpenter (workman). Esther has been a member of the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank for four years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought brooms to sell. She currently needs a loan for 2,700 PEN to buy a “carrito salchipapero” (fast food cart) and supplies for her prepared food sales. Esther’s dream is to have a well equipped restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a “carrito salchipapero” (fast food cart) and supplies for prepared food sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Los Mendes Group

texts.es:
El grupo los M. está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, ellas vende frutas en el populo mercado Oriental, considerado uno de los más grande de Centroamérica.

Jessenia M. de 27 años vende frutas desde hace diez años y Esmilda M. de 38 años también. Mientras María F. M. de 28 años hace quince años vende frutas y comida y de igual manera Miriam M. J. de 50 años tiene treinta años de comercializar frutas y comida.

Ellas ocuparan el préstamo para comprar frutas como naranja, sandia, calas, granadillas, aguacate, tomate, repollo, mandarina, limón y pitaya entre otras frutas de la temporada.
texts.en:
The M. Group is comprised of four hard-working women. They sell fruit in the populous Mercado Oriental. This is considered to be one of the biggest markets in all of Central America. Jessenia M., 27, has been selling fruit for ten years. It’s the same for Emilda M., 38. María F. M., 28, has been selling fruit and food for 15 years. Miriam M. J., 50, has been selling fruit and food like the others. They will use the loan to buy fruits like oranges, watermelon, passion fruit, pomegranates, avocadoes, tomatoes, cabbage, tangerines, lemons, and dragon fruit among other seasonal fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit like tomatoes, oranges, and dragon fruit, etc.

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: La unión hace la fuerza está conformado por Mayra Jerónima P.
texts.en: The Group “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Unity is Strength) consists of Mayra Jerónima P.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es: Francisca Elena tiene 39 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo.  Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora que ha salido adelante por medio de un gran esfuerzo. Su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno, sus inicios se dan por su Mama que le enseño a elaborar estos productos, al principio le fue muy difícil porque no tenía el  capital suficiente para establecer su negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que la mayoría de sus vecinos disfrutan de sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, dulce, azúcar y leche. El sueño de Francisca es tener un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca Elena is 39 years old and has 3 dependent children. She is a fighter who has managed to succeed through tremendous effort. Francisca has been in business for more than 18 years. She makes and sells baked goods, skills that she learned from her mother. At first, she encountered difficulties because she did not have sufficient capital to set up her business. She works out of her home and most of her neighbors enjoy her products.

Francisca is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to purchase corn, firewood, lime, preserves, sugar, and milk. She dreams of acquiring a plot of land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime, preserves, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen es cliente nueva de la insitución, su actitvidad es la venta de tela,que lo realiza en una galeria de la ciudad de El Alto, ella trabaja los dias lunes a sabado, esta galeria esta ubicada en  un lugar estrategico; la tenencia de vivienda es familiar,  vive con su familia, pero quiere en un futuro tener su vivenda propia,  es soltera pero tiene un niño de 2 años, actualmente cria a su hijo sola, con la ayuda de su familia, junto a ella se encuentra su hermana menor que tiene 18 años. El destino del credito es la compra de telas por mayor, para asi obtener un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a new client of the Institution. She sells fabrics from a shopping center in the city of El Alto. Carmen works Monday through Saturday, and her store is situated in a strategic location. She currently lives with her family, but she would like to have her own home in the future. She is single, but has a 2 year old son that she raises alone with some help from her 18 year old younger sister.

Carmen is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabric at wholesale and get a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: "Don Juan, tiene 40 años, actualmente se encuentra casado con doña Beatriz,  viven en la  la zona de pasankeri, su actividad principal es la elaboración de bombones de frutas y masmelos bañados con chocolate, la venta de los mismos lo realizan en la ciudad de Cochabamba, pero sus hijos estudian y viven en la ciudad de La Paz.El crédito solicitado es para la construcción, en parte,  de su casa en un primer piso, razón por la cual se fueron a trabajar a la ciudad de Cochabamba, ya que en esa ciudad realizan la mayor parte de sus ventas, ademas estan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 40 years old, married to Doña Beatriz, and lives in the district of Pasankeri. He makes fruit candies and chocolate covered marshmallows, and sells his products in the city of Cochabamba. However, his children live and study in the city of La Paz.

Juan is requesting a loan to begin construction of the first floor of his house. He wants to move to the city of Cochabamba because the majority of his sales are made there and his customers are located there as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of his house

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a la venta de fosforos y curitas (banditas)por mayor, ella distribuye estos productos en diferentes ferias y farmacias de la ciudad de El Alto y la ciudad de La Paz, el trabajo de la señora Julia es sacrificado por que ella tiene que caminar todos los dias  para realizar la distribucion de sus productos, ella actualmente esta tratando de obtener un puesto fijo en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, para no caminar tanto como lo hace ahora,  su esposo se dedica a la misma actividad  en  las diferentes ferias, la señora tiene un medio dia de descanso en la semana que es el dia domingo que lo dedica a pasar un momento en familia, el destino del credito es la compra de curitas por cajas.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a wholesale vendor of matches and bandages. She sells her products at different fairs and to pharmacies in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. The job requires much sacrifice because Julia has to walk all day in order to make her sales. At the moment, she is trying to obtain a permanent location at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto so that she doesn’t have to walk as much. Her husband engages in the same business, but travels to different fairs. Julia dedicates a half day on Sunday to rest and spend time with her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bandages by the case.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bandages

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: "Doña Beatriz tiene 26 años de edad y se encuentra casada con don Daniel, con el que tienen un hijo; dona Beatriz tiene como actividad la venta de chompas y blusas, el esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi con uno de los vehículos de su padre. Doña Beatriz realiza su venta en diferentes lugares o ferias de la ciudad;  en la zona 16 de julio los jueves y domingos donde tiene su puesto, luego en la ceja del alto, en Pocota, Batallas. El crédito solicitado es para ampliar su capital de trabajo, pues le conviene comprar al por mayor (docena) lo que le permite tener un mayor margen de utilidad."
texts.en:
Beatriz, 26, is married to Daniel, and they have a son. Beatriz sells sweaters and blouses. Her husband works as a taxi driver in one of his father’s cars. Beatriz sells in different places and in fairs in the city. She sells in the 16 de Julio zone, where she has her stand, on Thursdays and Sundays. Later she sells in La Ceja in El Alto, in Pocota, and in Batallas. The loan she is asking for is to increase her working capital so that she can buy wholesale (by the dozen), which will allow her to have a greater margin of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses by the dozen

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: La señora Olga Lidia es una señora la cual quedo viuda y ha sido una mujer que ha tenido que luchar para salir adelante con sus hijos siendo madre y padre al mismo tiempo. Ella siempre ha tratado de tener un hogar cómodo y agradable para su familia, y hoy solicita este crédito para realizarle algunas mejoras en su hogar tales como acabados interiores e instalaciones eléctricas para mayor seguridad, porque representan un peligro el tener el cableado fuera de sus instalaciones correspondientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Lidia is a woman who is widowed and has been a woman that has had to fight to get ahead with her children, being the mother and the father at the same time. She has always tried to have a comfortable and pleasant home for her family, and today she asks for a loan to make some improvements in her home such as finishing the interior and electrical sockets for better safety, because they present a danger with the electrical cables exposed.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finished interior and electrical sockets.

loans.name: Vencita

texts.en:
Vencita F. is from the village of Southern Looc. She is 60 years old. Vencita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vencita owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Vencita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Vencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vencita successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Vencita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Vencita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Haynee Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Haynee esta separada de su pareja, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos en edad escolar mas sin embargo esta situación no le quita el deseo de salir adelante y luchar para un mejor futuro para sus hijos y familia.
Tiene establecido desde hace 6 meses su negocio propio de nombre “Mini súper Primavera”, para el cual esta tramitando este crédito para la compra de mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Haynee is separated from her life partner. She is a single mother with two school-aged children. In spite of this situation, she has not lost the desire to get ahead and fight for a better future for her children and family. She has had her own business for six months. It is called “Mini Súper Primavera”. She is asking for this loan to buy wholesale merchandise to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan Francisco R. esta separado de su pareja, el tiene su negocio establecido desde hace 2 años de abarrotes; inicio su otro negocio ubicado en un ejido cercano a nuestra ciudad; es por tal motivo que el esta tramitando este crédito para la inversión de mercancía en ambos negocios para que sigan dando fruto.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Francisco R. is separated from his partner, he has had an established grocery business for two years, he started another business located in a piece of land close to the city; he is requesting this loan to invest it in merchandise for both businesses to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita M. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 67 years old. Benita is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Benita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over 50 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Benita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Benita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Benita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Guisselle

texts.en:
Guisselle D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 31 years old. Guisselle is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Guisselle owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Guisselle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Guisselle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guisselle successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Guisselle is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Guisselle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie G. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Elsie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products and also engaging in a cell-phone load business in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Tag-ibo, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie G. is from the village of Manticao, Iligan City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Merlie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita G. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Estelita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Estelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng H., 43, is married with two children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured).

To make a living, she sells various kinds of beverages at a local market in her village, earning an income of approximately US $4 per day, which is the primary source of income for her family. The family is also assisted by her husband, who operates his motorbike as a motor taxi driver. He travels from place to place in his province in search of customers, earning an income of US $1 per day in revenue. This couple tries to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for their family. The two children are also currently employed in a local garment factory, earning a reasonable income to assist the family and to make a living.

H. is seeking to improve her business, so she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more beverages to stock her store. By doing so, she hopes her current business will be able to generate more income for her household's use.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en:
Ngoun S., 33, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband.

To make a living, she sells breakfast, including coffee and Chinese noodles, to her existing and new customers, earning an income of US $3. She has to get up early in the morning every day to prepare her food shop while her husband goes fishing at a big lake in the province. S.’s husband is skilled in producing Cambodian traditional fishing traps, so he is able to catch a lot of fish to sell at the local market, earning an income of US $4 per day, which is the primary source of income of the family.

This couple is seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate more income, so Ngoun is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a big fishing boat for her husband's fishing business. The boat will also enable her husband to transport goods to her shop easily.

loans.use: To buy a big fishing boat

loans.name: Jellzen Melody

texts.en: Jellzen Melody G. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 27 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Jellzen Melody owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling scrap metal and other used-products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jellzen Melody joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Ms. Editha P., 29 years of age, is single and is a resident of Barangay I, Tangub City. She has one dependent: her adopted child, 2 years old.

Editha is currently engaged in operating an eatery which she has done for almost nine years. She started this business with an initial capital of only P2,000 and now she is earning an average gross income of P1,500 daily.

As a good member in our Coop under the regular loan program, Editha was able to obtain her second loan of P8,000 to add to the capital of her eatery business. The income from this activity will be used to meet their daily basic needs and to improve their standard of living.

Editha’s future dream is to expand her business by opening another eatery unit someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlyn T. is 28 years of age and lives in P6 Garang, Tangub City. She is married to Mr. Yashi T., a Japanese citizen. She has one child, who is still a minor. Even though she is supported by her husband, she still wants to earn an income from her own business. Six months ago, with help from her husband, she purchased a motorcycle with a cab to hire out. From this hire business she has been able to earn an additional income of 7,000 PHP per month.

As a new member of Kiva partner PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, she is applying for a loan of 25,000 PHP with the purpose of purchasing an additional cab to be attached to her newly acquired motorcycle. She is so thankful to PMPC for the support and trust given to micro-entrepreneurs like herself. She is hoping that, someday, she will be able to purchase additional motorcycles for her hire business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle cab

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda G. is from the village of Country Hill, Iligan City. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Luzminda plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a passion for direct selling. She is Mrs. Ruth S., who is 48 years of age and a resident of P3 Labuyo, Tangub City. She is married to Ignacio S. Sr. who is working presently in Qatar as an engineer. She is blessed with two adult-aged children.

Ruth started her direct selling business for Natasha Products five years ago with an initial capital of only 3,000 PHP. She has one outlet in Labuyo, Tangub City, and earns an average net monthly income of 14,400 PHP, which is of great help to her family.

As a newly recognized member of Kiva partner PMPC, Ruth has the privilege of applying for the amount of 25,000 PHP as her first loan under the regular loan program. She will use the loan to add to her capital for her existing direct selling business. The income from Ruth's business will be used to support her family's basic needs and for her loan repayments. Her future dream is to open another outlet to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital for her Natasha Products direct selling business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito H. is from the village of Green Hills, Suarez, Iligan City. She is 50 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Charito owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Charito has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Charito joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S. is a mother of five children and a loving wife to Mr. Procopio S.. She is 45 years of age and from the village of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. Jean operates a frozen food retailing business. Though her work is laborious as she processes her products herself, Jean really loves her business because it serves as her source of income. While Jean is busy processing her products, her husband, Procopio, is busy farming their field.

For Jean to earn more income, she sells her frozen foods in the different villages near their home. She dreams of improving her small business and being able to process more frozen foods to supply the needs of her customers. With this in mind, Jean is asking for the amount of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional capital for her business. She is very optimistic that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: As additional capital for her frozen food business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia B. is a 55-year-old widow, and a resident of Purok-1 Maquilao, Tangub City. She has five children, of whom four are married and live with their own families. Letecia lives with her 18-year-old child. For the past year, Letecia has run a business selling fish and snacks. She earns a minimum net income of 2,000 PHP per month from this business. She uses her income to provide for her family's daily needs.

As a good member of Kiva partner PMPC, Letecia has the privilege, under the PDP-LP Program, of borrowing the amount of 4,000 PHP in her second loan cycle. She is very grateful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She is enjoying PMPC's other products and services offered to all members. The proceeds of this loan will be added to Letecia's capital in her existing business, and the rest will be used for her family's daily needs and the loan repayments.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia G., 58, is married to Mr. Mariano G., 60, and they are both residents of Purok-6 Maquilao, Tangub City. They have ten children, some of whom are adult-aged and some of whom are school-aged.

Mrs. G. sells gasoline and operates a vulcanizing shop, which gives them an average net income of 3,500 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this business for ten years, and the income it generates greatly helps the couple in raising their family. Mrs. G.'s husband also earns income from farming, which also contributes to supporting the family's daily needs.

As a good member of Kiva partner PMPC, Mrs. G. has the privilege, under the PDP-LP Program, of borrowing 8,000 PHP for her seventh loan cycle. She is very grateful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She enjoys PMPC's other products and services offered to all members. The proceeds of this loan will be added to her capital for retailing gasoline and vulcanizing kits and materials. The rest of the proceeds of her loan will be used for sustaining her family's daily needs and making her loan repayments.

loans.use: As additional capital for gasoline and vulcanizing business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona G. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing clothing to local community members. Chona has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: "Don Alvaro es un joven que tiene 20 años, soltero y vive en la casa de su abuela, el mismo que a su edad tiene como actividad la compra - venta de oro, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad; a parte de esta actividad don Alvaro tiene como profesión la pasteleria, trabajando en una Fundación como panadero. El crédito solicitado por don Alvaro va  dirigido a la compra de un horno industrial para iniciar un nuevo negocio a parte del que ya tiene de la compra - venta de oro que es la de poner una pasteleria en su casa."
texts.en:
Don Alvaro is a young man who is 20 years old, single, and lives at his grandmother’s house. He buys and sells gold in the central part of the city. Part of the time, Alvaro works as a baker at an establishment where he makes pastries.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy an industrial oven and start a new business. Alvaro will continue buying and selling gold on a part-time basis until he can establish a pastry shop in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven so that he can start a pastry shop

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Mrs. Asuncion D., 50, is married to Mr. Bartolome D., and both are residents of Baluc, Tangub City. They are blessed with five children, most of whom are adult-aged. Ten years ago, Mrs. D. started a fruit and vegetable buy-and-sell business to help her husband in supporting their family. Now she earns an average net income of not less than 3,500 PHP per month. Her husband cultivates a small parcel of farmland and also runs a buy-and-sell business for pigs, goats, chickens and other farm animals.

As a good member of Kiva partner PMPC, Mrs. D. has the privilege, under the PDP-LP Program, of borrowing 14,900 PHP for her third loan cycle. She is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She enjoys PMPC's other products and services offered to all members. The proceeds of this loan will be used to add to her capital for her existing business, and the income will be used to meet the family's daily needs and for her loan repayments.

loans.use: As addtional capital for her fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia tiene 20 años, vive con su bebé y su esposo en casa de su madre. Desde hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de panes, los cuales reparte a las principales tiendas de su barrio. Lilia sale todos los días, en la mañana, para comprar directamente de un horno y distribuir su producto, pero los panes que no llega a colocar los vende en una esquina de su casa.
Durante todo este tiempo Lilia y su esposo han estado ahorrando y planificando su futuro, pues  ellos desean alquilar un horno panadero para que ellos mismos se dediquen a elaborar los panes y las ganancias sean más rentables para su familia.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy contenta de saber que va a  renovar  su ciclo de préstamo y se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos, como en el anterior. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para iniciar la elaboración de sus propios panes.
texts.en:
Lilia is 20 years old and lives at her mother’s house with her husband and their baby. She has been selling bread for 1½ years and distributes her products to major stores in her neighborhood. Every morning, Lilia buys bread directly from a bakery and delivers her products. If she has any leftover inventory, she sells those items on the corner in front of her house.

During this time, Lilia and her husband have been saving money and planning their future. They want to rent a baker’s oven so that they can make their own bread, which would be more profitable for their family.

This is the second time she has taken a loan with MFP. Lilia is very happy that she was approved for another loan cycle and promises to make her payments on time as she did with her previous loan. The money she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and ingredients for making her own bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 55 years old and lives in the village of Jurisdiction Amulung, Cagayan. She is married to Rodolfo and they are blessed with three children: Jayson, 29, a college undergraduate who now works as a soldier; James, 27, a high school graduate who now works as a security guard; and Jhay-ar, 25, a third year college student studying Information Technology. Due to hardships and difficulties in life, Adelaida only finished high school level. Despite financial problems, she and her husband work hard to send their children to school as they want them to finish their studies and become successful in the future.

Adelaida and her husband sell different kinds of cooked snacks in Jurisdiction Amulung, Cagayan. They also manage their farming business as an additional source of income. Due to their patience and sacrifice, they are able to earn a monthly income of 5,000 PHP, which they need to meet their daily needs and support their children's education. For the improvement of her business, Adelaida would like to borrow 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She will use this amount to purchase more goods to make her business grow and support her children's daily needs and tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her business
